user_review: My husband and I enjoyed an amazing evening and meal at Modavie last night. If you love lamb, you'll definitely want to visit. Our host, Lorenzo, was exceptionally welcoming and friendly. Our server, Enzo, provided excellent service and was very pleasant. Not only did we have a great meal, but the live music was the icing on the cake. A memorable evening for sure  in Old Montreal. Thank you Lorenzo and staff!Tammy & Chris

On special occasions when I want to have a version of French food in downtown montreal, I feel that this place is on the better side. Compared to weird pesudo-modern french restaurants in the surrounding venues, this place has a more traditional taste.I do hope that it was slightly brighter in the interior.My star rating is for balance between the taste and the price. It is high end, but it is more then I thought would fit.

Happening gourmand After having a great experience at Maggie oakes with this event we decided to invite our friends out to let them join in on the experience. Booked a table for 6 on Friday night at 6:30. Location is right on the corner you can't miss it you will hear the jazz from outside and see all the amber coloured tea lights on the tables through the window.Southern mule was one drink they had for the event gave it a go it was good just sweet. Same for the old fashion because of the honey they put in it. The olives in the martini were good and the cosmos were nice. Unfortunately they had no Jamieson maybe next time.I started with the foie gras which was delicious but the plating looked like nothing pretty awful to be honest. They could of added some fleur de sel or more chutney or something. The gravlax was good very flavourful but since 3 people ordered it at my table everyone's looked different and  that's not acceptable.Got the salmon which in my mind I pictured it another way but got something different. It was delicious I enjoyed every bite but again the way the described it was not what I got.Onion soup was good but it was +9The osso bucco tasted nice with the Risotto but one was cooked perfectly and than another plate had it not cooked properly. The plates didn't match again which is weird one had one big pieced and than someone had 3 little pieces.The crusted lamb was very good it came was potato's and veggies and a whole circle of goat cheese. This was +18Desserts were the lemon tart and brownie with caramel.Both were good but I prefered the lemon as it was refreshing after my meal.Service was good waiter was nice.

We came here to celebrate my son's birthday and listen to some jazz music on the second floor. This is a popular staple in Old Montreal.The atmosphere was great and this place hadn't changed that much since I used to come here once in awhile during my university days.The service was great and punctual which was not as obvious on a heavily crowded night. Definately you will need to reserve  for dinners during the weekends.Unlike some of the restaurants in the area, their bilingual  menu was simple, a one page notice.One thing though which I forgot when you have live music it's a little difficult to talk to each other.Like all things though street parking is difficult. On this night rue St Paul was being repaired however there are two public parking nearby $$$.
Good place to enjoy a solid meal in Montreal.  The food is good but there's lot of great food as well in the city.

Let me preface this review by saying Modavie is a 4.5 star in my book, I rounded down to differentiate with the true 5 star places I frequent.This was my third visit and was probably my best experience to date. We sat upstairs at a fantastic table for two by the windows as a heavy snowfall blanketed the port. The holiday lights on St. Paul were still on and the view was like something out of a Christmas movie. The live jazz set the mood for a nice dinner to follow.The wine list is packed with budget friendly and wisely chosen selections. We opted for an interesting sparkling wine from the Loire Valley made from Chenin  Blanc. I tried the French Onion soup that was well executed with a rich broth while my wife tried the Tomato Soup. Both were excellent. Mains included Cassolettes and Salmon. Both dishes were good although my Cassolettes was a little soupy by my standards. Total tab with tax and tip was $225..Service was excellent and friendly!

This place is a gem. We where looking for a place with great atmosphere, romantic, with music and great food. This is it. First of all in old Montreal so the mood is set already. The service was amazing, they make you feel welcome from the start, when you make a reservation it's only a 5 min wait for them to get you to your table. Make sure you put in your notes of reservation that you want to be near the music if that's what you want. The waiters are very attentive and don't bother youI once read a review complaining about their calamari. I'm a huge calamari advocate so I challenged that review and ordered it myself. The person who said they didn't like it because it wasn't very crispy obviously doesn't know food. It's calamari , not greasy fried onion rings. The calamari was Devine. Absolutely wonderful, perfect texture, taste, and crisp. They also provide free bread and butter.We ordered wine from their extensive wine list, very good selection, my ordered a Pinot noir to park with her dish , and so did I. We ordered lamb rack, and lamb chops. They specialize in lamb. They did not disappoint, lamb usually is pungent, but they made it so good, it did not over power at all, excellent cooking. Overall a great experience. Doesn't break that bank, and competes or beats other romantic places that break the bank. Overall score: 8.8 out of 10Vibes: 9Food: 8Service: 9.2

I brought my family here when they came on a trip to visit Montreal in mid-February.This restaurant covers style, good jazz, delicious food, and a fabulous bohemian ambience.As I went through some Yelp suggestions, I was intrigued by the Onion soup and the Lamb Rack.I agree with those previous comments telling me the onion soup is good as it gets. It was a great companion for the then chilly weather.I savored that dish similarly as one reads a good book: I did not want it to end. Later that night, surrounded by the jazziest voices and bass solos, a lamb rack landed on my table with a limelight. Of course, I shared that masterpiece with the other ravenous people at the table who could not stop gazing at me and the dish. If I could, I would share it with every reader because that rack was prepared with love and virtue. I understand why its smell could make any person morph into a hungry tiger. The gentleman who was our server and sommelier made the experience sweeter and so comfortable. I really do not remember what wine we ordered but it was good. Top choice for hospitality.This is one of the places I am longing to return. A bit pricey, but it is totally worth it.

My choice in main dish was disappointing, which is the only reason behind the star deduction. Other than that, it was a nice and pleasant experience and would visit again (to try something different).I personally had the French onion soup (starter size) which is probably the best I've ever had. Between the group, we shared the calamari and charcuterie board. I thought the cheese and meat were oddly cut.The Mediterranean penne was appealing for that few seconds when the server showed someone at our table what it looked like. I'll admit I didn't read the ingredients on the menu and was expecting some pesto type of dish. I was wrong. It was on the bland side but I got some flavours from the tomatoes and cheese. It was a good portion and the penne was cooked to my liking but I will not order this for myself in the future.

When I asked our walking tour guide where we should go for live jazz, she didn't hesitate when naming Modavie as the place to go. We are really glad we went - it was the perfect place for our last night of our Montreal anniversary trip!I was pleased when we were seated fairly close to the musicians who happened to be on break when we arrived. Our waiter was super charming - he came here from Paris because he likes the cold weather and to drive a dog sled team. He gets extra points for the very generous wine pour! My husband is a creature of habit and ordered the Mediterranean Penne for his main. He is not one to praise food ("food is fuel") so when he openly liked his dish, I knew it had to be good! From what I tasted, it had just the right amount of seasoning and was delicious. When I saw Niçoise Salad on the menu (yellowfin tataki tuna encrusted in sesame seeds, tomatoes, green beans, olives, potatoes, anchovies and hard-boiled egg), I knew that was what I wanted. It was gorgeous when it arrived, so fresh and delicious. In a word, perfect. The music started about 1/2 way through our meal and provided a beautiful and light ambiance. The trio that performed sounded very much as though they were influenced by Vince Guaraldi. We enjoyed them very much.If I am lucky enough to go to Montreal again in the future, I know I will stop by here again!

VIBES | Versatile | JazzVIBES: The Resturant has three vibes. An open area in front of the live music, a private back area, and back bar vibe. The place is in the heart of old town the interior shows that. Exposed brick and wood, give the place a warm feel. Versatile: they have a massive menu with a good combination of hearty American meals, French classics, and semi-soul food which was pretty impressive. Everything was really good. We were in a group of 6 people and we spanned their whole range of food and everyone was impressed. Jazz: so I'm the evenings they have a live soul/jazz music. We a trio (drums, lead guitar, and bass guitar) where the lead singer was also the drummer. Which was So intriguing and have the band a unique feel. They played Stevie, MichaelJackson, Clapton, and Earth Wind and Fire. What was impressive though was that it wasn't too loud. We were literally 2 tables away from the band and we could still hold a conversation. Pro tip: be ready to offer request. The band we had took request from the audience and played somePretty amazing jazz/soul versions of covers from the 70s, 80s, and 90s. Pro tip: I had the chicken, it was tender, juicy, and the combination with the vegetables was really good. I would definitely recommend it.

We were wandering around Montréal (where most bars don't open until 5), and stumbled upon Modavie.  What a great stop! Fantastic food and drinks, live music and great service...who can ask for anything more?!?

Had a great experience catching a seat at the bar recently. I came here for mussels and fries (moules frites) and maybe a small glass of wine to end my night in Montreal but stayed for the amazingly welcoming bartender Vincent. He made my night with his humor and recommendations making me feel comfortable and at home eating and drinking in the early evening. He also anticipated needs, refilling my water before being asked, worrying that maybe I was in a hurry to go somewhere when I checked my watch and even checking up on my entree before I really cared about it (i had been happily enjoying my rosé and the surroundings). The musician was nice that night (Friday night) too and had a great personality and singing voice.The moules frites were super tasty, I had the option to have ketchup or mayo as a side (with a recommendation from the bartender to go with mayo as I know the belgians do) and fries or salad or fries and salad and I went with the fries and salad option. It was wayy too much food (maybe shouldn't have eaten the bread that Vincent put in front of me as I waited for food) but honestly the whole experience was perfect. The bread was great with the white wine cream sauce that came with the mussels although I'm not sure you will always get it so make sure to ask for it if possible!Also if you get Vincent at the bar ask for a recommendation, I ended up with this wonderful lavender lemonade as a result.

This is where everyone from Toronto goes to dine with people from New Jersey. The interior design of this place is great. The front of house is also really good. Bar skills good.  The live music was great. For our mains we had the steak frites and lamb chops they were just o.k.

I came to Modavie due to it's proximity to my AirBNB and because of the reviews raving about their onion soup.AMBIANCE: 5/5I love the vibe of Modavie. It's elegant without being pretentious. The lights are dim, giving it a romantic feel. There was also a live band playing when we were there (Saturday night). Absolutely great atmosphere but difficult to talk after the band starts up.FOOD: 3/5French Onion Soup: I didn't like the soup but I really think it's personal taste.Foie Gras: This foie gras was different than the ones I've tried previously. I really don't have enough experience or knowledge to comment but this one was too heavy for me. The cranberries on the side cut through the heaviness.Lamb Chops: MUST TRY. The lamb here was great quality with no gamey taste. The vegetables accompanying were a nice touch - so you're not just chewing on meat the entire meal.SERVICE: 3/5Service was okay. The staff who seated us was wonderful but the server who waited on us was a little grumpy like he didn't want to be at work. Food and bill came out quick.
Very authentic lamb chop, perfectly cooked. The snails were very delicious. And the most amazing part is their wine selection. The live jazz will let you not forget the night at Montreal.

The service and food was impeccable. Will definitely be visiting again when I come back to Montreal. Also the French onion soup was so tasty, this is a must have. The outdoor seating was pretty but there is live music inside which almost makes me wish we chose a table inside. However the overall experience was amazing.

The manager was so great.  My husband had made a reservation but for the incorrect amount of people we were and when we got there they were full but he really went out of his way to fit us in.I'm glad he did because we had such a great time.  The jazz band that was playing was fantastic and really added to the evening.The restaurant itself is beautiful, the food was excellent and so was the service.I'll definitely go back next time I'm in Old Montreal.

it wasn't amazing and it wasn't bad. it was fine. i like the ambience, but food left something to be desired. got the french onion soup, which was just fine; i was expecting some golden brown bubbly goodness in the broiled cheese topping, but that was lacking. taste was fine. the moules frites had a really heavy cream based sauce, which i did not enjoy at all, wayyy too heavy. it overpowered the delicate mussels. also the fries, though plentiful, were clearly pre-packaged, frozen kine. they tasted fine, like mcd fries, but dang, i expected some homemade fries. husband had the steak frites and he said it was fine. overall, i was underwhelmed. i did not think it was worth the price nor the 4-star tag it has on yelp. wouldn't come back unless i couldn't get res anywhere else.

You could hear some sort of thump even from a couple doors down as you're parking. Then Jazz hits you! From where we sat for dinner on their main floor you can hear the Music. But if you want to soak up Jazz- front and center, request upstairs seating. Modavie is an excellent combination of atmosphere, setting and music- surrounded by 'Moulin Rougesque' posters, Brick, wood galore and copper ceiling pipes. Friendly service from our server Caroline and juggled orders like you don't even know! Our cocktails were inventive but were o......k.  Our Escargots In Puff Pastry was a winner and could've eaten 3 of those by myself! Hubby's Seafood Risotto was disappointingly mushy and tasted more like the incorrect rice-to-water ratio was used and ended up being sticky (°_°).Salmon with a Tapenade was excellent with Veggies and Couscous in my dish had awesome Curry, Herbs and Cranberry ingredients but it was scooped in a glob and was mushy too. (Maybe Grains aren't their strongest suit). In all honesty, hubby and I had a nice time. Modavie isn't probably near at the top of my list for Food in Montréal- but not ruling it out so fast either (for the live Jazz).

I made reservations for this restaurant on a weekend and I am so glad I did. The restaurant was completely full when we arrived during peak dinner hours. The environment was comfortable and there was live music when we came. It is nice place for a relaxing meal. Service:The food took a while to come but that was fine since we were enjoying the music while waiting. Our server was friendly and welcoming. However, he didn't check up on us often and we had to wave him down several times whenever we needed something.Food:We ordered a variety of items to share and the food was good overall. I liked the appetizers more than the mains. The foie gras was rich and creamy. It was absolutely amazing and it was my favorite item. The beef tartare was nice as well. Our least favorite item was probably the steak. We thought the steak was a bit bland and underwhelming. Overall:We enjoyed our meal here although the service could have been better. I wouldn't mind returning to this restaurant the next time I am in Montreal.

Came here with my wife for our wedding anniversary. Service 10/10Ambiance 8/10 way too loudFood 10/10 We were hoping this place was going to be quiet and romantic with jazz playing in the background but ppl were talking so loud like it was a night bar. And the louder people talked the louder the music got. Nevertheless we enjoyed everything they had to offer and the food was delicious

It was a great restaurant Perfect for a date, with the live music playing and the romantic atmosphere, I really loved it.The menu is very limited. They have only 1 chicken dish- the chicken supreme and I didn't like it very much at all because there was a lot of fat and skin on the chicken and it was very bland.They're wine list is extensive which I liked.For appretizers, we got the calamari, it wasn't crispy but more soggy but the quality of calamari was really good! I'd go again just for the atmosphere really, but not a fan of the menu :/

One of the best places I ate at. It was cold and snowing and I happen to just settle on this place after quite a bit of walking. So happy I stumbled on this place. I ordered the lamb poutine and a pulled lamb burger. I know, overload on the lamb, haha! The lamb poutine was alright.. it's a poutine. But that lamb burger! It was amazinggggg! If you can't think of what to try on the menu, get the lamb burger.It's a nice well lit restaurant. I was there for lunch and the ambiance was casual. I could see it being a nice romantic setting for dinner. It's a very nice restaurant. I enjoyed my meal and the service.

I'm very conflicted writing this review. I really want to give it a better score because the experience was really good however, the taste of the food was a bit disappointing. From start to finish, the service and ambience was fantastic. Our server was very friendly and efficient. We loved the live music and got a great table right in front of the band.  As for food, I ordered the beet salad, French onion soup and shrimp risotto.  Loved the salad and soup, it's one of the better French onion soup I had.  It was a great start to my meal but I guess all good things do come to an end because the risotto was a complete miss.  For $29, I can barely find the shrimps and worst of all, there were some really grainy uncooked rice.  I'm not a risotto expert but the risottos I've enjoyed in the past was a lot softer and saucier. This dish was just dry and undercooked. After a couple of bites, I had to send it back.  I appreciate our server took it back without any fuss. I felt bad for sending the dish back so I ordered another entree to compensate even though I was quit full already.  The Mediterranean penne came fairy quickly however it was also mediocre.  It's too bad the the food is a hit and miss otherwise this could easily be a 5 star review.

Wow and wow. I stopped in for an early dinner without a reservation. The hostess immediately sat me at my own table after I requested to not be at the bar. I also like that she told me when the next reservation was so I would be able to time myself. The waiter was totally patient with me and recommended the duck. Which was cooked to perfection! I ended with the pistachio crème brûlée. Totally delicious. Not that expensive considering I had 2 glasses of wine, an entree, and a dessert - $85CA. Didn't stay for the jazz but everything else was worth it.

Good, not great. The poutine was excellent. I had an Espresso Martini which was also very good. The braised boar was ok, slightly over cooked and the risotto was bland. The salmon was done nicely and definitely recommended over the boar. Modavie is a solid spot in a pinch,  but there are better options imo.

Started with the soup of the day which was a very thin, mediocre tomato and bean soup. My entree chicken was good and on a bed of truffle mashed potatoes. My mom had the Caesar salad and said that the chicken was inedible. She had tiramisu for dessert and liked it. This is a very popular spot for tour groups. When we were there for lunch, there was a group of 40 and a group of 60. Also, service was very slow.

This. Place. Was. BOMB.1/ Lamb chops. Oh my gosh - to die for. Perfectly seasoned and spiced, medium-rare and juicy on the insides, and just came perfectly off the bone with a bit of vegetables on the side.2/ Osso buca: wild boar and risotto had a yellow risotto oh so fine.We also got the poutine, which I would skip; poutine is meant for melty cheesecurds and just slightly too much gravy hot, dribbling, messy on thick fries. I wouldn't necessarily leave that to a fancier restaurant like Modavie.

The boyfriend and i decided that during our trip to montreal, we would make one of our meals a fancy one! we came across Modavie in our search and i'm glad we stuck with it! we arrived at 7 for an 830 reservation. we were hoping to grab a table early if possible. however we were turned away as they were booked for the night. so i told my boyfriend we would just come back later, at 8:30. to which the hostess have a confused look and my boyfriend let her know we had a reservation for later that night. After taking another look at the seating chart. she informed us that they magically had a cancellation and would be able to seat us early.. hmm sounds suspect. but whatever. we got to eat dinner early! it was a lovely place, and we were seated by the window. there was live music and the place reminded me of those parisian bistros you see in movies. our waiter was very nice and took our order. for drinks i got a glass of riesling and boyfriend got a glass of prosecco. and then we got the french onion soup, salmon tartar appetizer and for our mains i got the steak frites and the boyfriend got the seafood risotto. the french onion soup was AMAZING. i typically don't eat onions but i figured why not try the soup! especially after reading all the reviews about it! definitely did not disappoint! boyfriend had the salmon tartar which he very much enjoyed as well! for our mains, i got my steak frites cooked medium well. and although i've noticed some photos on yelp had a slab of butter on top of their steak i didn't get one on mine. not sure if they changed up their plating or what. but nonetheless it didn't make much of a difference cause i still enjoyed my meal. boyfriend also liked his seafood risotto. everything was flavorful and the scallops that came with it were also very good!it was a wonderful evening and i highly recommend reserving a table ahead of time as it seems like this place gets very busy!

My review here is limited to a food tour.   We were given a glass of rose and a small bowl of French onion soup as part of the tour.  We came here mid day. The overall look and feel of the place was very nice.  They had a live band playing and a cool vibe.   The wine and French onion soup were very good.

This place was recommended from a friend and I was ecstatic to see that it was included in the food tour that I had booked. The inside was so warm and welcoming that you can tell that it's a place you can spend hours in. Our tour included the lamb poutine and it was one of the best poutine that I've ever had. I really enjoyed this place and wished we had more time in Montreal so we could go back, but it is definitely on my list for the next time I visit!

We ordered the foie gras and salmon gravlax to start - I highly recommend the foie gras which was delightful with the crackers and paired jam. The salmon gravlax was also pretty good, but seemed just like a simple smoked salmon with a side salad. For our mains, we ordered the duck confit with risotto and seafood linguine - both of which were extremely delicious. My duck confit was so tender and juicy and slid right off the bone. My partner also seemed to really enjoy the seafood linguine as well; I had a bite and it was full of flavour. The ambience was so romantic and the live jazz music was a nice cherry on top. It is on the higher scale side, so expect for dinner to be around $30-$80 per person (depending on what you order and how many courses)! The only downside was the service, which was decent. I definitely recommend going to Modavie for excellent French food and a romantic night out!Tip: If you're going in the winter, you can hang up your jacket in a coat room at the front of the restaurant.

Made reservation for dinner. Lots of seating @ was 6:30 pm. Food and service were good but didn't feel exceptional.  They do have a dinner set menu but if you do the math there's almost no discount and choice are limited.

I had the duck confit on beans. The duck tasted good but the beans tasted like it was out of the can. The dish overall was very salty. I tried my friend's grilled lamb chops, it was ok. Another friend had their chicken supreme but the chicken was too dry for him.The place looks nice; we sat beside a window in the summer and it had a view of old port. They also have a patio.

Absolutely delicious steak cooked well done like I have never experienced well done before. Soft and buttery in the middle almost like a pot roast or a brisket but still steak like on the outside. Came with a lot of frites. We also ordered the truffle mayo which was delicious. Try the French onion soup!

Charming restaurant. We stopped in for dinner with no reservations in a Sunday night. Staff was so frequently and attentive. Vin Chaud was delish. We had the house made foie gras appetizer and snapper catch of the day. Both were nice options. I couldn't complain. The highlight of the meal was the pecan maple tartlett with ice cream for dessert! So so good!

Place was good but not great. Had a cheese and meat board with prosciutto, French sausage (can't remember the name of it) and goat cheese - which was pretty good.  The rosemary lamb chops were good but would like to have a little more flavor or spice with them I had to add some salt to give it a little more flavor.  The maple pecan pie was ok - looked great, sounded great but would have liked to have a little more flavor with this as well maybe warmed up with a little ice cream?  Service was good and it's a good spot in old Montreal.

Upon arrival in Montreal from the Detroit, Michigan area, we followed a friend's recommendation to try Modavie. We were not disappointed. We were seated by a window not far from the musicians - a female vocalist/keyboard and a bass player. Such a great atmosphere & the music was soft and romantic. We enjoyed our cheese plate, mussels and oeufs cocotte au foie gras. The atmosphere was light and airy. There was a couple nearby where the young man proposed to the woman - and she said "yes"!

We wanted something for a snack near the end of the evening.Modavie was Real close to our hotel so in we went. Fairly large place and very nicely put together. The service was great, it wasn't busy but they still hustled. We only had an appy each a bowl of French onion soup. Was very nice but pretty small portion for $12ea. The apple desert was nice also but not very big either. Had a really good dark local brew. I really enjoyed the live music, just one guy with his guitar but he pulled off some great stripped down original versions of some cool tunes and did a fantastic job!!Probably the best part of our visit there for me. We didn't really have much food to write about but what we had was good but not anything overly special and I was surprised at what the bill was for it. I'd give it a try again for a nice dinner next time I'm in Montreal but I'll be sure that my wallet is full first!

Dinner started out great. Service from our waiter was excellent. Told him place was a little warm and saw him checking the thermostat. Service throughout dinner was spot on. He came by to check on us. 5 stars for service!Now, to the zero star!!The manager/host, older and shorter gentleman, was very rude. If he's the owner than great for him, as that's the way he wants to run his business. It took our table a while to get our food and rather than coming by to check on us, he instantly reacted and said what do you expect! He didn't even asked his wait staff or us how long it took. It could have been 1 minute or 5 or 20 minutes. He just said it will take a long time to bring the food out because of your group and said what do you expect? I told him that we expected the food to come out at the same time or close to it. Just rude. Our waiter came by and took over as the runner. Again, the waiter was excellent. We had a party of 7. One runner was bringing out 2 plates at a time and there was a long wait in between the runs. I guess this is normal according to the manager? Host? Or owner? Whoever he was. Food was good. Onion soup could use more onions. But the cheese and way it was baked was awesome. Sea bass was a little over cooked. And, it was cold. My plate was the first one that was served; therefore, it was cold. Ambience - five stars. Great romantic place with live piano and performer on Sunday night.

My girlfriends and I went to Modavie for the occasion of Happening Gourmand. Unfortunately, their menu for happening gourmand weren't as appealing compared to other restaurants who are participating in that event. So we went outside of the Happening Gourmand menu. The 1st service was good and quick then our waiter finished his shift, and the next waitress took over, sadly, the service was lacking speed and help. Food wise, I started with onion soup; it was delicious. For my main meal, I had salmon tartare with fries. The flavor was little bland for me, and fries were over cooked. Then I got the cappuccino and tiramisu. It was the best tiramisu I ever had. Super light and delicious.The place is beautiful and rustic. The ambiance was fun and energetic. I hope next year, their menu for Happening Gourmand would be slightly better.

Sizeable portions and lots of choices. We came for lunch on the weekend and they had music playing. There was a brunch menu in addition to the usual offerings as well as a lunch menu that included a soup or a salad. The lamb poutine was pretty darn good as was the tartare. My wife got a huge mound of risotto, which I gladly dig into. Well seasoned, albeit maybe over salted. Nevertheless, we cleaned our plates. It was a busy day but the place was big enough to handle the crowds. Good for a group because the music adds a nice atmosphere and there is enough selection to satisfy everyone's palate.

Was looking up "best french onion soups" in Montreal and Modavie was one that popped up. We weren't here for long but figured at least one of the dinners we eat should be one fancy one. I made a reservation for 530 and we ended up being late but it didn't matter I think because it didn't get that busy till a lot later. It's very dark in the restaurant but has nice vibes. We sat near the door and it got a little chilly because well. It's winter. Seating area can be a little squishy but it's not too bad. Services was great. Food was good. The french onion soup was packed with flavour and the cheese was just amazing. It's the best when the cheese keep stretching. My pasta was interesting. It looked like a salad because it was all green. There wasn't any meat in it (wish there was, not sure if there's an additional add-on). It wasn't bad, tad plain. Tasted very healthy for sure.Desserts: cheesecake was probably my favourite. Not too sweet either. I don't really remember much as it was a while ago but I had a great time here. Warmly greeted by staff and generally good food.

Modavie was a great choice for my friend's bachelorette dinner. Although their specialty is lamb, they offer many other protein choices and everyone seemed pleased with the flavors on their plate. We were seated right next to the live jazz, and the music added a nice ambiance without being too overwhelmingly loud and keeping us from conversation. The servers were very friendly and we were greeted and seated promptly despite showing up 20-minutes late for our reservation.

My husband and I came in for charcuterie and wine before going out for even more drinks. I'm so glad we stopped here! Our server was absolutely fantastic. She recommended some great wines to us and was very knowledgeable in the differences between the two we tried (aged difference of about 15 years). The atmosphere is fun, romantic, relaxed but also modern/classy. The charcuterie and fromage was delightful! I always try French onion soup when it's on the menu and this one was delicious! Definitely had a red wine tasting broth. Our server also gave us great recommendations for places to visit afterwards and they were ON POINT! Definitely will be going back when we're in Montreal once again.
I got the ham sausage and duck confit! Perfectly cooked and seasoned. The serving is huge and great for the price. The rustic interior design is very pretty. Me and my friend were very impressed!

Everything was lovely. Upon entering, we were greeted and seated by friendly staff. The wine and entrees were lovely. Perfect for date night or girls night. There was live music playing but also there is a separate room further away from the music if you prefer a more quiet dinner. We order the halibut with TRUFFLE MASHED POTATOES and lamb chops with risotto. I emphasized the TRUFFLE MASHED POTATOES because they were simply spectacular. I'm salivating thinking about it.

Great food, horrible service. I made a reservation for 2 people on a Saturday night and they put us at a lovely high top by the window. However, our server was a bar tender and worked the bar mostly and was not attentive to us. Maybe the high top was a bar seating? If so, we shouldn't have been sat there for a dinner reservation.The food was phenomenal- lamb poutine for appetizer, and order of saffron risotto entree, and the boar entree. Everything was delicious, even the starter bread and butter! I'd likely try it again for the food but would be specific on where I sat.

I found this place on yelp and tried it because it offered steak and fries along with other French cuisines that my husband could recognize. And boy, were we surprised and happy with our meal. We came in on a Tuesday without a reservation and the hostess was so nice and seated us immediately. We ordered drinks and had some French bread (phenomenal). For an appetizer, I ordered the Caesar salad - that was perfect. It had great lettuce, cheese and pieces of bacon. My husband ordered the lentil soup (which he liked). For our meal, I had the lamb chops! Whooooo buddy! They were fantastic. My husband the catch of the day - swordfish. All and all, a great place to try! I will definitely be back if I am in Montreal.

Nice bistro in the old Montréal area, the service and music were perfect, we started with a Caesar salad with bacon and the fried calamari both delicious  Also had  the beef tartare, risotto, filet mignon and steak frites everything was cooked to perfection did I mention how great the music and ambiance were.... great first dinner in Montreal setting high standards for a very promising weekend.

Better than we expected for a "touristy" restaurant in Old Montreal.We came on one of the last days of happening gourmand. We enjoyed all the food we had except for the lamb poutine. When it arrived, it wasn't hot and had way too much sauce. The sauce was a bit too salty and was watery. I don't recommend it at all, and it certainly wasn't worth the 5$ surcharge. All the orders of poutine except for one came out right after we ordered. I think it must have been the last portions of a big batch because we could tell it wasn't fresh. The last poutine that came out was about twice the size and was steaming hot. My partner, the lucky one who got the fresh poutine actually really enjoyed it.For mains, most of us had steak-frites and one ordered the Duck Confit. We were all impressed with our meals. Dessert was a choice between cheesecake and tiramisu. Both were delicious.If it weren't for the poutine, I would give this place a 5 star review. The atmosphere is cozy and the live jazz music is a serious plus. I'd recommend asking to be sat in the room next to where the music is being played. That is where we sat and we heard the music perfectly but it wasn't overwhelmingly loud. The service was excellent and friendly.Food:3.5/5Value: 4.5/5 (for Happening Gourmand)Service: 5/5Atmosphere: 5/5
See check in review. Great service.Ordered the lamb burger. It was juicy and not what you would expect for a "burger".My daughter order the steak and it was cooked to her liking.Definitely recommend.

Modavie was a very, very enjoyable dining experience! Our waitress was extremely sweet, attentive and knowledgeable about the menu which is something I really love when I am out to eat -  anywhere that can make genuine suggestions about the wine and food gets an A+ in my book.We ordered a bottle of wine and some appetizers to start. I was disappointed in the escargot puff pastry but that was just me. I had the mussels for my meal and the serving size and presentation were amazing. We had an adorable table in the corner by the window, on the main floor and it was perfectly charming.My only complaint is that they told us we had to give up our table at 9pm for another party but when that time came, our waitress was no where to be found.. so we were a little bit stressed that we had to rush but no one was really being attentive to us. Did not become an issue as they did not try and rush us out we were just a bit confused.

Hotel recommended, and hits the top of Yelp list when you search dinner in this area. The first trip I tried to eat there, I showed up without a reservation and they were fully booked through the Monday night. Next trip we made a reservation and it was available for all time slots, so just reserve to be safe.The atmosphere is very cute with 3 large rooms (bar area, jazz room, and anither cozy room in the back) and live jazz every night which was part of the draw for us! It was a lively crowd and nice to have the music as we were dining, setting the stage for a lovely dinner.I went with a group of 3 so we did all our plates to share. I'm sad to say we either ordered poorly or the food was just not as spectacular as I had hoped. Once we ordered we asked the server if there was anything great missing from our selections and he said we were covered so...The poutine was our starter, and were all v hungry so we kept eating it although it did not stand as one of the better poutines we've had in Montreal. Mains we ordered the Mussels and frites, Steak frites, the Chicken Supreme and a side of Carrot risotto.The only thing in our entire order that I would go for again was the Mussels- which were served in a big bowl with a delicious white wine sauce and a heaping pile of fries. The steak was fine, and the chicken that sounded so good on the menu was not good - however the truffle mashed potatoes that were served with the chicken were worth eating (I love truffle anything so that's an easy one for me). We didn't stick around for dessert but we noticed that pretty much every person in the restaurant was going for a slice of tiramisu and I'm curious to know if that would have saved dinner..

Cool live music with a lively dining experience...what a great night!  My wife and I shared the french onion soup and the caesar salad with lardons.  I think I make a better french onion soup, but the caesar was flavor.  I loved the addition of pork lardons with a caesar.  We also had the calamari which was tender and tasty.For mains, I had the steak and frites.  It was cooked properly and seasoned well.  I ate the whole plate...every last french fry.  My wife had the shrimp and saffron risotto.  She didn't eat the whole thing, but it wasn't because she didn't love it.  They just served a healthy portion.Dessert was a creme brule.  Nothing to write home about but satisfy the goal of ending the meal with something sweet.This place has solid food and service.  What moves it to 4 stars is the lively environment with cool live music that wasn't too loud but added to the ambiance.  I would highly recommend for folks looking for live music while eating dinner.

Every so often you hit the jackpot on a restaurant choice when you visit a new town. This was one of those times.We arrived 5 minutes early for a 6:30 dinner reservation and the maitre d', Lorenzo, quickly showed us to our table -- as requested away from the live music in the bar area.Our waiter, Patrice, was clearly quite experienced and offered to help select a bottle of wine. I knew that I wanted a Bordeaux and asked him about a Haut Medoc in the $75 CDN range, which he agreed that the 2005 vintage would be exceptional. He quickly returned with a lovely decanter which he took great pains in filling to avoid sediment and accelerate opening. The wine was truly lovely and we enjoyed a glass with still-warm French bread and butter before ordering.Lorenzo, the maitre d' and long-time restaurant manager, stopped by several times to ensure that we were being properly taken care of, although I am sure that he knew his staff were performing well.I splurged on the house specialty sesame-encrusted rack of lamb, while my lovely bride-to-be went with a perfectly seared Atlantic salmon with olive tapenade (which I'm sure she chose because she knew I wouldn't like the tapenade). The seasonal vegetable side (carrots, parsnips, mini sweet peppers, zucchini) and gremot potatoes (salted small roasted potatoes) were a wonderful accompaniment. Yes, the wine was a tad "big" for these foods, but I like my red wine and this was a night to splurge.We normally do not order dessert, but I still had a glass of wine to finish so I asked about the Poudding Chomeur (French words that I hadn't picked up way back in high school). Poudding Chomeur literally translates to Unemployment Cake, and uses ingredients commonly available during the Depression (flour and maple syrup) to create a wonderful -- albeit sweet -- concoction that I had to cross spoons with my fiance to get enough of. I simply loooove real maple syrup (although Vermont gets the nod for best Grade A IMO).We really enjoyed Modavie...the decor, layout, staff, food and service were all exceptional. We simply love it when the staff are attentive and engaging, and Lorenzo and Patrice were certainly engaging and played the perfect hosts. We will be back in town at the end of our vacation in a few weeks and will likely stop by for our last meal before returning home!

This was my third time going to Modavie, and I went for specifically happening gourmand. The $29 table d'hôte was a great deal and for the options of dishes offered, it was a good value. Being a French bistro in the old port of Montreal gave the restaurant a rustic vibe. However, what differentiates it from other restaurants in that area is that there are live musicians, and I believe this is a great addition for the restaurant. The service was good and music wasn't too loud. For happening gourmand, there was 3 options for an entrée (I had the panko fried brie which was good), 3 options for a main course (I had the tagliatelle with mushrooms which again, was good) and 2 options for a dessert (I had the Black Forest tulip which was my least favourite dish). They also offer a lot of sides at a decent cost, so I got carrot risotto which was my favourite! My group and I had a good time overall, but the food met our expectations, but for the price we paid, it was worth it!

Loved this place! What a nice date night/night out romantic restaurant. This place has live music everyday and a chic bar area.You definitely have to make reservations or you would either have to sit at the bar area (limited seats) or wait for a while. We didn't expect it to get this packed for a Monday evening and didn't mind if we sat at the bar table. The service was great and our waitress was very friendly and attentive. She kept refilling my water for me and asked if everything was okay.We got a Braised Lamb Poutine to share. It was slightly salty for me but the small fries were really crispy and the braised lamb was soft and flavourful.I got the entree Salmon Tartare with a salad and the portion size was huge. The only downside to this dish was the crouton bread, its too hard to bite on. The tartare and salad were delicious though! I also got to try the  Braised Pork Cheeses with Risotto, it was yummy!Overall, this place was the perfect last date night for me in Mtl. A great way to end off my trip at Modavie.

The muscles and fries were pretty good.  The bread is nice and warm.  I didn't really like the shrimp ricotta.  The calamari is decent.  Overall it was a good first time experience. Nothing to crave for - after the fact.

Loved this place it's their combination of French and Mediterranean food. Service was great, drinks very good, I observed a couple getting wine and the pour had to be 6+ ounces!!The food all around the table was very good, beautifully presented and excellent flavor. It didn't seem like the tourist trap of so many pleases in this area..

****4.5 out of 5 stars****I'm always in search of nice French bistros, and Modavie hits all the marks.  We requested a table not too close to the jazz live band, as we want to talk and chat.  The hostess sat us to another dining room just across from the live band.  It was the perfect spot, quiet enough to talk and also get to hear the soothing jazz music.  I really like the skylight right below our table, which makes taking pictures ideal, especially the food pics.We started off with the appetizers.  The French onion soup and calamari.  It was very good, just wish it was a bit warmer.Some of the members of my party ordered the table d'hote, which included a garlic snail appetizer and raspberry and rhubarb tart as dessert.  The main course was either the elk ravioli and duck breasts.  See pics.  The other guests ordered a la carte...pork cheek served with risotto and filet mignon.  Overall, food was to our satisfaction, only the elk ravioli was a little too al dente.The service was usual, not over the top.  Just right.Now the small downside which was beyond the restaurant control was that the credit card terminals were down.  Other tables were waiting to pay as well.  We had to wait about 20 minutes for their terminal to reboot.  After 20 mins, the machine were still not working.  The waiter had to do it the old fashion way by writing our credit card numbers by hand on a slip in which I don't feel too comfortable, but I had no choice.  They should have a better backup plan in the future instead of customers waiting for such a long time to pay their bill.Overall, I would come back again.  The food and ambience was excellent.

We returned to Modavie in June of this year and once again had the best time. We were able to make reservations and we were seated the moment we walked in. The jazz music is the best. It is not too loud, it is just really good. What a great addition to a wonderful restaurant.This time I had the snails and this was my first time having them. They were amazing. So tender and filled with flavor. The service is perfect. I think our servers name was Victoria, but I am not positive. All the people there are great. All of the food is wonderful. I had to have the onion soup again because it is the best I have ever had. The duck confit is marvelous, tender and served with tasty beans. It is a great place to take a walk after dinner as well. It is all just magic. Have a wonderful time.
Duck and lamb dishes were so delicious here! Tender with rich flavor.Wine and cocktail were so so.

This was such a great find for brunch!  I went here on a Saturday for brunch with my friend and we both were blown away.  The service and the food was phenomenal!   We each had mimosas and we ordered charcuterie with Brie, lemon sausage, and morbier to start and not only was the presentation lovely but it was absolutely delicious.   My friend ordered the sesame seed crusted ahi tuna salad and I ordered the shrimp saffron risotto.  The ahi tuna salad has spinach, olives, green beans, boiled egg, anchovies, tomatoes and of course, the tuna!  The shrimp saffron risotto had chorizo in it as well which was so delicious.  Their menu is labeled to show what's safe for each food allergy which is just a plus!  Their food is fresh and made to order.
A little pricey but has delicious (also interesting) food. The meat we had was very tender and melted in our mouths. Excellent food and good service.

Absolutely amazing dinner.  Service was so prompt and gentle.  By far the best beef tartare I've ever had and I recommend it 100%.  Duck was a little over cooked but the beans it was in totally made up for it. The flavors were so amazing.  I recommend the duck as well.

First and last time eating at this restaurant.  We had the salmon and sea bass ( fish of the day).  Salmon was fresh, cooked well, but way overpriced. Sea bass was terrible.  The sea bass came with pickled mushrooms, capers and gherkin pickles.  Yuck!  The best part of the sea bass dish was the small amount of kale salad that came with it. The restaurant is in the heart of Old Port. (Could be why pricing was so high).  This restaurant received good reviews---maybe we ordered wrong.
Everything so good, best new year dinner starter haha had onion soup and foie gras torchon! Asked for extra oder of brie and braised lamb, everything wonderful

One of the worst and most expensive meals ever! We came here for New Year's Eve and paid $95 pp for their pre fixe menu.  2 choices for appetizer, soup, glass of mead, choice of entree and dessert (no choice).  The service was minimal and slow! Got there at 8:30 and didn't receive our entree until 10:30. The lamb was gamey and fatty.  Pumpkin soup had no flavor. The dessert was ok at best.  Had high hopes for our last night in Montreal and was a big disappointment.  Stay far away.

Yum!! Such a cool restaurant and bar. Love that they take reservations. Love the live jazz music. Love the style of the interior. Food was great and not what I was expecting in terms of portions (they were big!). Had the calamari and lamb chops. Calamari appetizer had so much calamari I had to send it away with over half still on the plate! Came with 2 sauces to dip - a marinara and an aioli. Lamb chops were good but I'd probably get something else next time. My friend had the rack of lamb which looked good and I snuck a bite of that delicious cheese it came served with!I like that the wine comes in 5 oz and 8 oz pours. Hello, 8 of course! Wish I had room for dessert because they all sounded good but the wine was enough!

Well first off I may be partial as this is my most favourite restaurant in Canada.  Food & service is over the top.  Now if have never been here the only two things I re on end.  One meet LORENZO As the most gracious host you shall ever meet, kind, funny, and all around perfect host.  On the floor serving the second choice and equally important is to have Caroline be your server. Now this experience does not get any better than her.  Charming, witty, perfect and most of all genuine.   Last and certainly not least.  The lounge/bar is the most beautiful personality SONIA, I cannot say enough about this gem.  It's like an angel touching your heart.   I hope you go and enjoy the BEST PLACE in MONTREAL

We're celebrating Christmas in Montreal this year.  We wanted a special holiday dining experience for Christmas Eve, and Modavie delivered in spades. Beautifully decorated, highly attentive service (Simon was amazing!), and a wonderful prix fixe menu.  And soft live jazz on two levels.  A truly wonderful experience.

Excellent place. Live music, food and wine are fantastic.  The french onion soup is by far one of my favorites ever. We also had the wild boar osso bucco- delliissshhh.  Great super friendly service as well.

I was definitely not expecting my favorite meal on the Montreal trip to be at a small little restaurant locating in an extremely touristy area, but here we are.We'd spent way too much time looking for somewhere decent to eat in Old Montreal and when we came across Modavie, I kind of just said we're eating here and didn't even look at the menu.We took a seat at their very comfortable, very quiet patio and were immediately greeted by an incredibly friendly and helpful server. We weren't looking to eat anything too heavy, so we decided to just order a couple of appetizers:Fried Calamari: This has to be one of the better variations of this venerable classic I've ever eaten. The calamari was perfectly breaded and fried, and didn't contain any of the chewiness you sometimes get with bad calamari. And they were accompanied by two addictive sauces that proved a perfect complement (a creamy one and a tomato one that was surprisingly spicy).Duck Rillette: I'm not sure what separates a rillettes from a pate, but at any rate, this was delicious. It comes presented on a plate with crunchy toast and an assortment of nuts and berries and honestly I was blown away by how flavorful and melt-in-your-mouth succulent it was.I rarely mention alcohol in these reviews, but I have to single out the chardonnay we both drank. It was a brand called Oakbank and it was a perfect accompaniment to what turned out to be an incredibly laid-back, delicious lunch.

Absolutely love this place! Fantastic vibe and great food!The food at Modavie was very good! We had the foie gras to start which was flavorful with an excellent glaze. The entrees were just as impressive. My lamb burger was succulent and full of flavor.The staff were excellent, our only complaint was how long it took us to get our food. From the time we ordered to when we were served it was 50 minutes. Needless to say we were starving!Overall we loved this place! The live music combined with a romantic atmosphere was hard to beat!

Walking by Modavie, on a whim I walked in and asked the maitre d' if there were any reservation available. Lorenzo introduced himself and said although the restaurant was busy, he could get me a table. When we arrived he was able to get us a nice table near the live jazz.The staff was very attentive and professional and the quality of the food was excellent. Truly a great dining experience; I would highly recommend Modavie to anyone visiting Montreal as a top priority.

Absolutely fantastic! This is my boyfriend & I 3rd time visiting during our trip. We were looking for another French restaurant around the area but Modavie seemed to be the best choice! We will be back for sure!! So far our favorite restaurant in Montréal!

Our first night in Montreal we decided to check out Modavie. After all, live jazz, great reviews, within stumbling distance of our hotel... it had everything going for it. We were seated upstairs in a very crowded space, but right in front of the stage. The music was fantastic, and surprisingly not too loud given that we were literally face to face with the performers. The atmosphere is everything you'd hope for in a Montreal jazz institution - dark, old, full of character and story. The fact that people were tripping over us to get to their tables and that the buzz of conversation and clinking glasses seemed almost as loud as the music wassomehow just right.The food at Modavie, however... well, that wasn't quite as "just right". We started  with a small charcuterie board which was fantastic, by far the best part of the meal. I ordered the Steak Frites and Troy had the Pork Cheeks.The fries with my steak were by far the best part of the plate - thin and crispy and plentiful. The steak, on the other hand, was a pounded piece of cheap meat, so thin that there's no way they could have cooked it to my "rare" specification. The sauce that topped it was bland and brown. It looked like it was designed to cover up sins instead of enhancing the meat.Troy's Pork Cheeks tasted like pork and nothing more. They were served atop a bed of rice, which did have sone flavour, and topped with microgreens, which were admittedly a nice touch. We really enjoyed Modavie for the atmosphere and the music. That said, if I have the opportunity to go back, it will be for appys and drinks.- definitely not dinner. The meal just wasn't worth the price.

My partner and I went to Modavie for a celebratory meal while visiting Montreal for the first time. We agreed that it is one of the best meals we have ever had! As I am a vegetarian, it was especially wonderful to have a meal (the butternut squash cavatelli) that was not an afterthought for the menu but an intentionally delicious, savory meal. The wine, cheese plate, and creme brûlée kept pace with our delicious entrees. And to top it off, our server (Radouan) was a welcoming, informative, warm, and utmost professional server. Could not recommend enough!

A fantastic spot for a romantic date night or get together with friends (maybe not the best spot for kids though I did see a few families). Service was attentive and the food and wine list did not disappoint. The price was quite reasonable, especially for a place in the center of Old Montreal (an appetizer, two entrees, one dessert, and a mid tier bottle of wine came up to 120$ before tip).

There wasn't much I didn't like about Modavie. The food was delicious, the service was excellent. I had the lamb and switched my potatoes for truffle mash, changed my life. The lamb was cooked perfectly.The atmosphere is fantastic. In the heart of Old Montreal, the live music was so much fun. We didn't once feel like we were being rushed, we stayed for several drinks after our meal. Will go again for sure.

We had lunch/brunch here while visiting Montréal. Overall it was mediocre. I started with the Lamb poutine and it was pretty good, my wife's tomato soup wasn't. I had the Bolognese and can think of three places within 20 minutes of my house that have a better one, including a hotel restaurant. My wife didn't particularly enjoy her sandwich. Maybe I'm being generous with 3 stars, but the service and drinks were good.

Strolling through the old town of Montreal this weekend, we walked into Modavie for the second time. Old world charm with a few great rooms that are each unique onto themselves. The front room is livelier and has live music typically jazz at night. We were seated in the back room that is larger and more spacious between tables. Our waitress was attentive, polite, and very knowledgeable. We started with a homemade cognac foie gras torchon with a pineapple, onion and ginger chutney with rye brioche. I was a little surprised that it was not allowed a proper rest period right out of the walk-in. After allowing it to loosen up a bit, it became spreadable and we enjoyed the chutney combination. This was followed up by a Caesar salad with lardons. The perfection of the dressing with the anchovies, the silkiness of the yolks, cheese and perfect croutons pairing with the lardons was so good I could've stopped right there and been very happy! But when I saw the wild boar Osso Bucco with Milanese sauce, saffron risotto with sage, parmesan and hazelnut, well, I just couldn't pass that up. Good Lord I hate a mushy risotto! This risotto was perfection. I especially enjoyed the textural crunch of the hazelnuts!! Now for the wild bore, I had hoped it had a similar braised texture that falls apart upon diving in with the expected gaminess of the bore. It was a bit tough, but it could've simply been the cut not the length of braising? It was a good tasting dish and seasoned just right, with the potential miss step. The Somm recommended a Côtes du Rhône Villages, Le Ponnant, La Ferme du Mont 2017, France which we enjoyed throughout our meal. We ended the night with a pecan tart. The foie being way to cold and the bore being a bit too tough, brought me down to a 4 from a 5, which I was prepared to give them. I will return to try other dishes because I love the space and the staff. Phone battery died sorry no pictures.

Wonderful! Great atmosphere and impeccable service. The food was amazing!Appetizers- French onion soup very good, Shrimp cocktail fresh tasting. Chicken supreme- tender juicy chicken with tasty vegetables . Spaghetti was delicious and perfectly cooked. The desserts were the best ever! We ordered Tiramisu and raspberry cheesecake!
Lamb was good, duck was great, pasta was okay, steak was okay. Poutine was so so. Server was busy but he was very nice to us. Oh I liked the bread.

Happened upon this restaurant after a visit to the Basilica.  What a wonderful meal we had!  Wine was excellent (at the advice of our waitress.). Lamb chops were fabulous!  Risotto was so similar to my grandmothers!  Definitely recommend.

As the last day of my wonderful trip to Montréal, I really wanted an amazing culinary experience. I certainly got that dining at Modavie! The maitre d'hotel, Mr. Lorenzo Baldassarre, was an amazing host that ushered us in with so much love and laughter. Mr. Baldassarre and his staff took care of our every need with such passion. The food was incredible! Both lamb dishes were cooked to perfection in perfect harmony with the spring vegetables. The drinks were creative and strong. The dessert - absolutely amazing! Please try this restaurant and tell Lorenzo "bonjour".

I ate here on Christmas Eve with my daughter and we had a really nice meal.  While it as a little more expensive than I would normally be happy with given what we had, I expect that a holiday prix fix menu has to fit their constraints and be a little more profitable than normal.  All the food was good, the service was great, the place had live music and a really warm vibe.

I was really pleased with my meal on my recent trip to Montreal. I was not overly hungry so I ordered the Beef Tartare. It was actually my first time trying Beef Tartare and it was quite the treat. I enjoyed the  pine nut and avocado that were mixed in with the tender beef. The place has a really nice vibe and in my opinion is reasonably priced given the area/food quality. They also have a amazing cocktail list which I should have explored more!Our server Rad was also great. Very friendly, attentive and knowledgeable!

Modavie was the first place we ate at while in Montreal; we were starving and hot from all the walking around. I quickly checked their Yelp reviews and decided we'll go inside and have a nice cocktail and some grub. There are many places to eat in Old Montreal, but Modavie being directly on the corner of all the action of Saint Paul spoke to me. We decided on having a seat at the high seats next to the window, with a view of all the people going by. It's a very elegant French restaurant without the need for getting dressed up all fancy. We checked out the wine menu and we both went with a glass of Riesling.  We decided we'll pick a few things to start and share with each other. We ordered the poutine which I was informed by our server is their version of junk food. It's basically fries with cheese curds, gravy and braised lamb. It was a large portion, tasted really good. We both enjoyed it very much and would come back for it again. We also ordered the Beet Salad along with a side of fries.This place was great for a late lunch not sure how dinner is but our food and service was great. We left with content full stomachs with enough carbs to fuel our walk around Old Montreal.
Great music, good atmosphere. Great drinks and wine choices. My risotto was phenomenal. Good appetizers. Overall a wonderful experience for the price point.

What a lovely, cozy ambience! The osso bucco with saffron risotto paired with a glass of red wine was so delicious I floated out completely content when we finished. And the live jazz music was the cherry on top of a really great restaurant experience!
Good option in Montreal! Good atmosphere and music plus great food. Great place for lamb, steak and chicken!

Lamb chops to die for! So good, full of flavor and perfectly cooked. The lamb chops were out of this world. Served with a nice selection of fresh vegetables and nice roast potatoes. We also had a side order of risotto and that was wonderful too - just the right touch of creaminess.We were seated very close to the music on a Sunday evening but it was a nice selection of songs and not too loud to impede talking. Our server Daniel was superb - very attentive and took excellent care of our group of five. Thank you for a very nice evening.

We ordered the duck confit & the seafood linguine. Both were enjoyable, but the linguine was the show stopper of the night. The linguine was much more flavorful and rich. Each strand of pasta was drenched in a tasty sauce unlike anything we've had. The ambiance at Modavie is what you would hope an evening meal in Montreal would look like - a dark lit room and great live music that isn't too loud where you can't hear your own voice. The assistance from the staff was ok, we thought they could have been more friendly and helpful.
Great ambience and awesome food.  I had the Rosemary Lamb chops.  Love the seasoning.  The staff very friendly and service was on point.
Enjoyed an excellent wild boar chop and salmon tartare. Great waiter and good jazz music.

Great place for a couple to enjoy a nice meal and live music (Jazz, blues). Live music every night at the perfect volume to enjoy but also still be able to hold a nice conversation without having to compete with the musicians. Food was great, I had the lamb shank. It fell right off of the bone. Done to perfection! Highly recommend in a nice location just a block off of the river. Note: parking behind the restaurant will be $13 for the evening. Good luck finding anything on the streets

Venue, atmosphere, service and entertainment (live band) absolutely a five / five! Our server was SO sweet and attentive. The band played a great mix of classics that kept the energy up, some women even got up to dance. We LOVED the bread and beef tartare. Our Cornish hen papperdelle dish was flavourful, but it didn't thrill us nor would we order that again. I had originally ordered the market fish which I was so excited about (Marlin) which is one of my favs but she came back to tell me they ran out I had to settle for salmon, which was a generous portion but lacked flavour especially when paired with the risotto. The dessert which was a creme coffee caramel, was delightful. I would go back for the ambience as we ended up meeting the people sitting next to us and had a great night!

Love the vibe when I walk in. Went there for my birthday. The waiter was very nice and patient which is why I'm giving three stars. I ordered the steak and fries and I only like the fries. The steak was just awful. HOWEVER the calamari is AMAZING and tasted soooo fresh so you have to try that. I tried the creme brûlé and it was not good at all.

Came here for a date night- toddler free, on our trip. Coming from NY, so we had a lot to compare this place to. Let me tell you...We ordered a lot of food. Just for the two of us. List is as follows:Apps-lamb poutineFrench onion soupBOTH THE BEST WEVE EVER HAD. Neither were too salty. They were incredibly delish. Dinner- Seafood linguine- outstandingLamb chops- their known dish. Hubby LOVED. Tender and good quality. Great seasoning. Food was superb. Desert- creme brûlée. The best I ever had. Wow. Wow. Wow. Beers also fresh and service was good. 5 stars.

We went on a weekday evening and it was very crowded. There was a live music which was in the level of the place (professional but not very tasty chosen). The menu is nice and has quit good option although for a such place it is expected to have more options on the menu. There was no vegetarian or vegan option. The service was not bad but could be faster and more efficient. A friend ordered medium rare steak and got overcooked one which they accepted their mistake and brought her a another dish. Fish of the day was nice but a little bit overcooked and dry. The wine menu was extended and had a lot of good options.

We were headed to Robin Square, but unfortunately they were closed.  Wandering around, we saw Mondavie.  Friendly greeting when we walked in.  Lorenzo is crazy funny!  We decided to sit at the bar, and he told me that if anyone came in, I was suppose to seat them if he wasn't up there.  I felt at home.  The bartender, Kim, was friendly and funny as well!  We all felt at home. I ordered the poutine with braised lamb.  This tasted more like the traditional, however, that first one in Vancouver will forever be my favorite!  Two of us ordered the lamb chops since that is the house specialty.  The others had the steak frites.  The chops were grilled perfectly!  They came with some assorted vegetables and a rosemary marinade.  The others said the steak was ok, nothing spectacular.  I'm of the opinion that the lamb is the way to go!Our bottle of Malbec didn't last very long, so we though another was in order.  It was fun sitting at the bar and watching all the guests coming and going.  We started making up stories as we watched, like the couple on the first date and her thinking, "How do I get out of this?" and him thinking, "She's the one!"...things like that.  They also have live jazz playing which is nice, especially if you are in the main dining room.Again, Lorenzo and Kim made the visit so much fun and enjoyable.  I would definitely come back if ever in the area!

Lovely evening with bunch of nice people. Had the steak with fries and was completely satisfied. A bottle of California Cabernet Sauvignon, beets salad with goat cheese and a smooth cheese cake finish! This all came with some jazz, played and song by a lovely band accompanied by dancing customers and staff of the restaurant. Could not ask for more. Will visit again for sure.By the way we visited during an event offering a less expensive menu.Staff were nice and friendly, although it was packed and very busy service was quick and satisfactory.

I picked this place for the live band and atmosphere which was nice but the service was definitely a turn off. The waiter barely checked on us and walked by several times for an hour without clearing our dishes. We ordered off the brunch menu but I did not touch the soup they served as it did not taste good. When I expressed my dissatisfaction with the soul he said it was my fault for ordering it. When my entree came, it was nothing like the description. I was expecting French toast with eggs and ham but got a cold French toast sandwich with cold cut ham and mayonnaise. When I told our server he blamed me again before taking it away. After waiting over 2.5 hours and not eating anything I was ready to leave. The waiter refused to take my items off the bill and was rude while my boyfriend was paying the bill. The atmosphere is nice but service was the worst I had ever received.

An OKAY dining experience. I really wanted to be head over heels in love with this restaurant, and I had high expectations. It was so cute walking in, with the dark colors, low lighting, and bar backed by a staircase. Picturesque. We were seated promptly near the musician and he was fantastic. Our server was affable. We were really set up for success. But then the food. Just okay for the most part. My salad, missing something. The soup? Came out so cold that we thought it was actually supposed to be served chilled! We inquired with the nearest employee who promptly whisked away our cold soup and a few minutes later replaced it with hot soup. The hot soup was much better than the cold soup, but it was only okay. Needed a lot of salt and pepper. The entrees were good enough, I would certainly order mine again if I were there - but for the price it didn't quite meet expectations. It was the rib with mashed potatoes and veggies. There was definitely something missing - maybe just a little more au jus would have done it. I didn't enjoy the dessert at all. My husband ordered a goat cheese tart and absolutely loved it. He also said his penne with mushrooms was perfect. So maybe I had just ordered the wrong dishes. Overall, great vibe and good enough experience. 3.5 rounded down to 3 because the food wasn't quite there.

Nice ambiance and warm welcome here, but mixed results from their food. Service was quick and friendly, I went for wild boar osso bucco, my wife had the steak frites. On the positive side the steak was well cooked if a little swamped by the mountain of frites.  The osso bucco was well cooked and falling of the bone as it should. However, it was tasteless and under seasoned. The sauce had no flavour what so ever for such a long slow cooked dish. The accompanying risotto was over cooked and flavourless. Such a disappointment for slow cooked potentially very flavoursome joint of meat. They need to step up the food game quickly before the season escapes them.

Lovely French bistro in Old Montreal. We were seated in the original section of the restaurant which was nice. Complimentary bread with butter was good. Foie gras torchon was good with a berry compote. They recommend the lamb chops here ($32) you get five chips with some seasonal vegetables. My first dish came out cool temperature wise, dry and well done. I pointed it out to the server and she immediately took it back. She didn't say too much when she took it away and when she brought me back a new dish. Oh well the second one was much better as it was medium rare and tender. Flavours were ok but I've had better. My friends loved the seafood pasta and the steak frites. Caesar salad was large but way too overdressed and dressing tasted kinda off. Service was fine and offered gluten free options. Bathrooms could be cleaner.

My boyfriend and I wanted to have a nice dinner in Old Montreal during our 24-hour stint in the city. After a quick Yelp search, we landed on Modavie and it was absolutely perfect! Located on a bustling corner in the heart of the neighborhood, Modavie is a lovely French restaurant with ample seating both indoors and outdoors, along with daily live jazz. We opted to sit outside as it was a beautiful night, and we were able ton indulge in some prime people watching. Our waitress was kind and attentive, recommending a great sparkling rose and also indulging my wishes to practice my French (greatly appreciated!)We ordered the calamari, lamb poutine and nicoise, which was the perfect amount of food. Though perhaps more expensive than usual - on par with New York prices - it was well worth it. Would definitely return on my next trip to Montreal.

Visited here twice during our last visit to Montreal. Once for lunch and once in the evening for drinks and to listen to live music. Lunch as great. I had the tuna Niçoise salad. It was delicious. My husband had the gnocchi and said it was flavorful and soft. The wine and beer menu was nice as well. When we returned to hear the live music, we were disappointed to find out that to get a seat in either of the rooms with the music, it required ordering dinner. We sat at the bar and could see/ear the music, but it was a much different experience. Overall, restaurant was great and I would go back again.
Friendly staff, fun wine selection, and good food. Also, good live music. Often visit this restaurant when I'm in Montreal and it never disappoints.

My wife and I visited last night after finding Modavie here on Yelp. We were both pleasantly surprised. The service was excellent and the food was incredible. My wife had the cassoulet and I had the wild boar osso bucco. We both remarked how perfectly seasoned both dishes were. Too many times a dish is over-salted, and that is as definitely not the case here. This is fine French dining the way it's supposed to be done.
Modavie did not disappoint.  Give the cassoulet a try and the mussels are an excellent choice as well.  Service was outstanding and friendly.
Great drinks, food and service. Jazz band was bit loud but we expected it. Fun songs, upbeat atmosphere and waiter was top notch!

We stopped in here while waiting for the laser light show at the Basilica, and was pleased to be able to sit outside by the street.  We both had delightful meals and enjoyed our interaction with our waitress.  We both drank a draft beer and ordered different meals and both were outstanding.  It was so cool to be sitting outside on the sidewalk while visiting Montreal in September.  My wife ordered a salad and freaked out when she saw how large it was.  It must have been good, since she ate it all.Montreal is over 12 hours drive from our home, but will certainly make the effort to come back and to this great restaurant too.I do recommend this restaurant.

This was a really cool restaurant. It has lots of different rooms, a bar, and live music every night (which runs from 7pm to close).  The food was very good - I had the Table D'Hote consisting of a peach salad, a halibut and grilled octopus dish, and a key lime pie dessert. All were excellent, although the halibut was a touch dry (the octopus more than made up for it).  Service was friendly and fast. They have two seatings, with the second starting at 9pm (at least on a Thursday night).Since we came as a business group hoping to talk, the live music was a bit of a distraction. It was a bit on the loud side, even though we were in a side room (and not in the room with the stage). I think they pumped the music through speakers to other rooms. So, be warned that if you are coming to have a quiet chat, the music may be distracting.

We stayed at Montreal for 4 nights and we had the worst night of dinner at Modavie. It's located on Rue Saint Paul so the location is very convenient for tourists. I ordered a seafood risotto which supposed to have lobster clams crab and scallops.  The dish used fake crabmeat and there was no lobster and no clam, very disappointed.
Absolutely wonderful. The food service and atmosphere was fantastic. I highly recommend this restaurant for a special event or a date night. You will not be disappointed!
Late post. But this place is excellent. When I come back to Montreal, I'll be sure to visit this place again...

A nice find amongst the many French restaurants in Montreal/Old Montreal. The space was a larger than we initially though so there was plenty of room for us at about 9:30pm on a Tuesday night. There was a live guitarist finishing up when we got there.We started with the braised lamb poutine and the French onion soup which the waiter told us they were known for (I think maybe all French restaurants say this.) The soup was great and cheesy. The onions had definitely been caramelized well.
