The poutine was also good, but the fries were a little skinny for poutine so the gravy:fries ratio ended up being a little to high for me.My mom and I both got the sesame crusted lamb with the goat cheese potatoes. Lamb was cooked perfectly medium rare and the sesame crust was crunchy. Could have used a touch more salt. I LOVED the potatoes, they give you a huge slice of goat cheese - as much or maybe more than the amount of potatoes they give you. That's what I always hope for in cheesy potatoes. For dessert we split the apple pie, which our waitress told us was their best dessert. Coming from the US (specifically the southern part of the US) it was not apple pie as I know it because it was deconstructed. There was a pie crust surrounding a very artistic looking mound of cinnamon apple slices. That being said, it was tasty and much less dense/filling/intense than a typical slice of apple pie. It's served with maple syrup (of course) and ice cream. Our waitress was super friendly and smiley which I always appreciate. She also kept our water glasses full which generally equates to an A+ in my book. A bit pricey, but a nice special occasion place in the scenic old Montreal area.

[Montreal Food Tour Stop #3] Modavie Resto-Bar is a hip restaurant with tasty French food in the middle of Old Montreal.  I was looking for a slightly more upscale meal to enjoy my second night in the city.  There's a medium sized cocktail menu and a decently sized wine menu.  Some dishes on the menu include foie gras, beef tartare, steak frites, salmon, and ratatouille.  Also, live music is played every night.  I skipped the wine and went for a three course meal with my friends.  Highlights: The poutine here is excellent.  There was only one type of poutine on the menu.  It was served with your standard cheese curds and gravy - but there was also braised lamb.  This is a big upgrade from poutine from ground meat (which is also good too, but lamb makes it great).  The meat was soft and tasty and the overall dish was not too salty.  For my entree, I ordered the market catch of the day, which was halibut served with risotto and vegetables.  The entree was very light and I really liked my risotto.  Our waiter was entertaining - he was boasting that Modavie's poutine was the best in all of Montreal.  I admit that I haven't tried enough poutine in the city to back this claim, but it is very good and I will recommend it.  For dessert, I ordered the creme brûlée.  Decent - not outstanding, but good in my opinion.Critiques: I would have preferred that my halibut be seasoned a little more.  I definitely had a good time at Modavie, but judging overall taste and price, this is probably 4 stars in terms of value.Overall: Very good food in a great part of Montreal.  You'll have a pleasant time and enjoy a tasty meal with good service.  Also, lamb is the way to go when you're choosing a meat to add to your poutine.

We had high hopes after reading the menu online, but were very disappointed with the quality of the food and drinks. Our cocktails were watery, and the food was mediocre. We ordered the charcuterie as a starter (which is actually more expensive as a whole than if you were to order the individual portions), and there was nothing special about it; it seemed as if each piece came straight from the package. We ordered the saffron risotto and the duck confit cassoulet as main dishes, and both were barely warm and cooked badly. We opted not to stay for dessert, but still ended up spending $125 on a meal that was disappointing at best.  I was surprised at our experience because many reviews were so positive, but I can only guess that is because the restaurant is in a busy tourist area. My suggestion is to find somewhere else to eat.

Great music! GREAT SERVICE! We rarely go to the same place twice on vacation, but for this place, we did. The server was VERY nice and friendly. Also very attentive. The food came quick. It was absolutely delicious and reasonable price. We were also seated almost immediately. Can't say enough good things about this place. I would love to call out our server by name, but I got the feeling that they are all pretty great here. If you go here, you are gaurunteed a nice meal/experience.

I came here with 4 other friends from New York City for Sunday lunch. The place was fairly empty at 12pm. We were seated on the ground floor near one of the windows. The decor is wooden rusty. There were jazz music background. Now the food:- foe gras: nothing to write home about, but it was good with bread.- smoked salmon: it was good but not too special. It looked nice though with the piece of salmon twisted like a flower. - duck confit: solid classic dish that was perfectly done. It had right amount of fat and slightly crusted skin. This was my entree- rack of lamb: my friend ordered this and I got a bite of it. It was awesome with baked goat cheese and sesame seed garnish. Overall, this was a classic and solid French restaurant.
Really nice place and highly recommended by all locals in the old section of Montreal. Waiter Marc was extreamly attentive, Be sure to ask for him.

We went there for Tuesday Happy Hour for the acoustic music (nothing to write home about) and the drink savings. I would go back, as it has a nice vibe and really charming service. We got a nice charcuterie and cheese board. Very nice wine selection. If you go, make a reservation ahead of time, even for 5pm. It must be a very popular spot, because it was packed the entire time we were there with a line when we left at 7:45pm. Totally accessible for kids. There were many families there.

Doesnt make any sense  this restaurant has such high rewiews.We order seafood risotto and spaghetti. The plates tasted bad and took long time to get ready. At that time,there  were not that many people , and it seems we are the only Asians there. The manager places the candles on each table carefully but for our table, the bang sound is hard. That was fxx rude. Furthermore，he lights up all the candles except for my table.Come on, Montreal, now it is the 21st century，this shit makes me sick. We asked for the check more than three times , they just kept us wait.Very disappointedMen, please go to other restaurants..

Modavie was recommended to us by a local friend. After several hours of walking in the blustery Montreal evening, we made our way to the restaurant. Much to our pleasant surprise, we were seated in front of the fireplace with no reservations!We ordered our standard favorite appetizer - French onion soup - and it was very good.  The steak Tartar was one of the best I've ever had. The atmosphere was very warm and cozy. As we were finishing our dinner a live band began to play which we did not stay for.One drawback was that they did not serve mulled wine which I thought was more commonly served in Montreal. Overall, Modavie was a very nice dining experience.

One of the most delightful meals I've ever had. We saved Modavie for our big family night out meal on a visit to Montréal. The food was amazing - even the kids were happy. We happened to be there on the night a live musician serenaded us with acoustical guitar. He was so good he almost outshone the food but not quite!  And the setting in Old Montréal was absolutely magical. I wish we could go back once a week!

Modavie is a treasure. The French onion soup was absolutely perfect. The wine selection was stunning. And the food... Although Modavie has a full menu, it's really all about the lamb, which was magnificent. The service was also top notch. My only regret is that I had no room to try their dessert menu.
Server was friendly, she recommended lamb dishes which turns out fine. The mussels are cooked in creamy sauce very tasty. The sphagetti a but overcooked but the meat tastes good.

We made reservations for 7:15pm for four people.  We arrived around 7pm and were promptly seated within a minute.  The restaurant is a fairly decent size and has an upstairs, where our table was.  Our waitress, Victoria, was friendly and courteous and continually refilled our waters throughout the night.The food was excellent.  We started with the beef tartare and the garlic snails.  The appetizers were delicious and done well, and we were given extra bread without hesitation for the beef tartare.While waiting for the main courses, our server apologized for the delay.  This was nice as she had attentive to our table throughout the night, and honestly, our table did not feel that we were delayed at all.  The mains came out minutes after she apologized.  I ordered the sesame crusted rack of lamb served with vegetables and baked brie on potato.The lamb was cooked perfectly to medium rare as requested and was juicy and flavourful.  The sesame crust was interesting and added an extra crispy texture, but I didn't find it made a difference in the taste.  The brie on potato is something I've never tried before but would highly recommend it!Throughout the night, Victoria checked up on us and filled up our waters, made sure we were doing ok, and at the end of the night apologized for the heat inside the restaurant.  It was a little warm inside but Montreal is experiencing a hotter than normal weather condition so it cannot be helped.Our party had an enjoyable night; the food was great and it's been a while since we had good service!

Located in Old Montreal on Rue Saint Paul  W , a very happening and busy area.We sat in the bar area which is huge because on the other side was live music.Started with  French onion soup and a beet salad with goat cheese and candied walnuts. Both were very good.For entrees, we had the grilled lamb chops rosemary marinade and chicken supreme with a mustard demi-glaçe. Both were very flavorful and tasty.They have a very nice wine list.
DELICIOUS!!!! We visited this restaurant just before leaving Montreal and it was perfect. Their onion soup is to die for! Great staff and fantastic vibe to the place even early at noon.

One of the best restaurants in Montreal. We had fantastic time here last night. The waiter was great who has worked in this restaurant for 21 years ( doesn't it mean something?!!!). The food was great, wine is fantastic. We ordered shrimp risotto and salmon which both are so tasty. Staff was super friendly. We enjoyed a great deal. Definitely recommend to anyone want to try here.  We made reservation for tonight again.

Food was decent. Service was terrible. One of the first to arrive for lunch crowd. Ordered promptly: a traditional French sandwich and soup. Bread and soup arrived promptly. Then waited almost 40 min for the sandwich to arrive. People who had come in 20 min after I did, were getting entrees. Would not waste my time coming back with so many other good choices in the area.

What I really like in Montreal is the french food and if I have the possibility to get some 'Moules et frites' (mussels fries) I can't resist. Ok it's not rocket science -  haute cuisine - to make some mussels with a good sauce, but they were really good. We've been there on a Saturday night in April - not high season yet. We got a table right away. Service was really friendly and also the chef passed by to ask about our well being. In one of the Yelp reviews I read that this place is a tourist trap - from my visit experience I can not confirm that - but as I said it was slow season so possibly in high season it's different because it's located in a very popular area in the old town. Overall the prices were reasonable for the location also playing life music. We enjoyed the ambience and the food very much.

Montreal's old town is as close to Europe as you can get in North America. However, the food choices in the Old Town are truly terrible, Modavie included. We ordered two glasses of wine, the catch of the day (walleye with vegetables), and the lamb chop (per the recommendation of the waitress). The fish and lamb courses were brought before the wine and bread even arrived. The lamb was average, but the root vegetables were badly undercooked. Everything was dry and flavorless. The walleye special was much worse. The fish filet was scrawny, mushy, and flavorless. The vegetables were likewise overcooked, and the only flavor I could taste was the pepper I added. According to Yelp, Modavie is the best restaurant in the Old Town, but after my experience, I would take the metro to a less touristy part of town if you want to get a decent meal.

What great live music and food!  If you are looking for some traditional french cooking with some great live music, you found it.  We had a party of 8, and the waitress handled us perfectly.  The highlight of the evening was an acoustic guitarist singing everything from Sweet Caroline to Billy Jean... it somehow fit with the food and the wine!  I highly recommend it, if not for a bit pricey - but hey, you are in vieux montreal!
Quintessential French bistro with traditional menu. Beautiful little bar area. All food was fantastic. Service etc ...a  happy place!

It was my last day in Montreal and I was really looking forward to eating a bowl of French onion soup on this cold day. While the atmosphere and service were exceptional, the soup was not. I guess I still have not found that perfect French onion soup outside of a restaurant I frequent in Dallas.

This is a great spot in old Montreal! We stopped here on a whim for a late lunch and were happy we did. With its wooden walls and warm lighting, it felt very cozy.For our meals we split the mushroom risotto with duck confit and the lamb, fennel, and sun dried tomato pasta. Both were excellent! I was especially impressed with the duck - this restaurant nails it.The service wasn't notable.

I did like this place, the food is great and the ambiance is decent. However, today I had one of those experiences with the restaurant management that completely negated every positive association I had.I brought a group of my friends here for happy hour. It was a large group of 7 people, but we were refused to be seated at a table because of our size. All 7 of us had to cram into the bar. This may be reasonable if the restaurant was busy, however, the place was practically empty. There were tables everywhere and the place emptied out further as out dinner progressed. We were crammed in this tiny bar amidst a sea of empty tables, which ruined our dining experience, it was quite ridiculous.Even though we came for happy hour, we spent good money. However, my friends and I were treated like 2nd rate customers. We will likely not be returning, which is a shame because I want to like this place.

Had a great night at Modives! The highlight of the visit was the live music, with a three-piece jazz group. The lead singer was fantastic! Big personality and really engaged the audience. We'd go back just to listen to him. The food was decent, but not great. Started with a beet salad with goat cheese that was excellent...then had a fillet mignon that was nicely prepared and a sea bass dish that was good. Would definitely pay them another visit.

I recently had an early Sunday dinner at Modavie while visiting Montreal.  It's in a nice area of town in Old Port however I was underwhelmed by my experience here.  The service was slow.  The French onion soup was OK.  I ordered the lamb chops as my main dish since the menu said it was their specialty but there was nothing special about the dish.  It said it came with potatoes and seasonal vegetables but it was a pitiful portion of each.  Perhaps this place is more lively later at night when there is live jazz.  Unfortunately, we couldn't stay for that since we had other plans.

The live music was good!I tried their special course meal with frog legs and quail. Personally, i didnt find the food surprisingly good. It was ok compared to the high price we had to pay. But its definitely worth going to have some nice music and wine.

My family agrees that our favorite meal from our trip to Montréal was from Modavie. Our waiter was charismatic and very attentive. The french onion soup was delicious and so was the Cesar salad. The menu could have included more options but everyone in my group found something they wanted. We recommend this place for lunch or dinner!

The filet mignon was perfect; however we did not love the risotto. It was good but not great, had been cooked with clam shells that were removed so it had a fishy flavor and the seafood didn't stand apart in the dish so it was a little mushy. I give it 4 stars because the filet was that great.

I got completely fooled by the large number of reviews and other websites. This place is awful . Avoid at any costs. It took over one hour to get our orders. And, between 6 orders we placed 3 of which were wrong orders. Believe me even if things were all right with our orders I would have not given them more than 1 star. The quality of the food was below average. One may ask how come they have got high rankings if the food is below the average and the service is poor. It's simple when you pay big, you would come up with all none-sense internal  argument with yourself to convince yourself that your money worth it.

I would not miss this place!Incredible food,ambiance, entertainment, drinks, and above all service! We went there for a friends birthday and our waitress Josiane made the evening perfect. Favorite night in Montreal.

I came here while in town on my "mini-moon".  I had wanted to try this place since we walked by it on our first night and tried it a few nights later.  It was good but didn't blow my mind.  I had the lamb chops and it just seemed like a smaller portion for the amount of money.  If I came back to Montreal I'd probably pop in here for drinks/apps but do dinner elsewhere.

After walking around Old Montreal looking for somewhere to eat with a good atmosphere, we stumbled across Modavie. They had live music but without reservations, we were seated in a section that didn't see the band, but could still hear the music. We had the mussels, Caesar salad, and seafood linguine. All dishes came with a generous portion, and the waiter would come by with heaping amounts of Parmesan cheese (who says no to extra cheese). Though touristy, on a rainy Tuesday evening, Modavie provided the perfect setting for a spontaneous night out.

Best Service I Have Received in MontrealI came in for dinner and had an amazing experience. The service a at Modavie was exceptional, we were promptly greeted by Lorenzo, who was funny, warm, and welcoming.  He sat us in the right next to the live music that started at 7pm, and so I was initially worried that it would be too loud, but it was actually perfect.  The small band was amazing and the music volume and selection was perfect.Our server for the evening was excellent, we never had to lift a finger. Our water and wine glasses was always full, and he did an excellent job of explaining the menu in both French and English.  I had the Steak Frits,  and it was cooked perfectly.  I believe the steak might have been a hanger steak in a delicious sauce.I would highly recommend  Modavie and will certainly be heading back.

It seems like we definitely needed our reservation here since it was very crowded. The decor and menu is what you would expect from a French restaurant and there is an extensive wine list. The duck entree I ordered, which came with a mushroom risotto was ok only. The skin of the duck was very good but the duck meat itself was a bit bland, as was the risotto. The others also didn't seem to love their dishes, which made me wish we had dined elsewhere since we were only visiting Montreal for 3 nights. The fries that came with the mussels were good - the typical type of fries served at French establishments and it also came with a large amount of mussels that we couldn't finish.

Good food and very friendly staff. Lorenzo (manager) was very friendly and professional. We had the rack of lamb, poutine and mussels. Everything tasted great. Kevin was our server and did a great job. Give a try if ever in the area.

TL;DR: Great food but service & ambience subpar to the prices of the food.The rack of lambs & seafood linguini were excellent as well as the neige martini, however; service not to the price standard & from where we were sitting we couldn't even see the band--the resto is poorly laid out. Our waitress gave us a lot of silent attitude. The band was playing not in harmony and took TWO breaks in one hour!

We came to this restaurant because it had such high reviews and specialized in lamb, but we were sadly disappointed despite the romantic charm of Old Montreal. We started the night off with drinks, but were sadly disappointed by their use of premade mix and not egg whites for their sour drinks. Although, they did serve us with a giant glass goblet, which was much appreciated. We then had the lamb poutine, which really did not do justice to the classic Canadian dish. We had to hunt for cheese curds, and the sauce was practically absent. It was literally a spoonful of lamb on top of, surprisingly, crispy fries. We also thought the lamb was oversalted.The entrees were average at best. We had the sesame-crusted lamb chops, which were okay but nothing to write home to your mama about. The brie mashed potatoes, however, were definitely interesting and stood out in this dish. We also had the catch of the day, which was, again, average. Not what I expected from a French fine dining restaurant. If you're looking for drinks, go somewhere else. If you're looking for poutine, go somewhere else. If you're looking for haute-cuisine, go somewhere else. If you're looking for an average restaurant to hide from the snow and rain from, come here. You're welcome.PS If you're looking for a nice and romantic ambiance, this restaurant (the bar area) is alright.

Dinner with the family visiting from US; my kids got the Penne w/meatball and was ok. Wife had the red-snapper and was excellent. I had the pan seared salmon and it was amazing. If taking kids, it's better to go on the early side; we got there around 530 got crowded around 7. Prices were on par with the area, and quality of food.

Had such a great time at Modavie! I came here on a Friday night with two girl friends. All three of us were in Montréal for the first time and loved exploring the city. Modavie was a great spot to end the evening with lovely live jazz music and delicious menu offerings.We ended up visiting during a restaurant week of some sort where they had a discounted prix fixe menu of starter, main, and dessert. We all opted to get that, with different combinations of the beet salad or poutine to start, lamb and risotto or steak frites as the main, and cheesecake and tiramisu for dessert. All of the flavors were absolutely perfect and you can tell the chef puts a lot of work into each and every meal.We also shared a bottle of red wine. The wine list is a bit daunting, but there's certainly something for everyone, taste- and price-wise.The atmosphere was so lovely and our server was beyond amazing. He didn't even turn up his nose when we stated that we were just too full to have our desserts there and would it be terribly gauche to get them to go. (Sidenote: they kept very well and we all feasted on them for breakfast the next morning!)
What a great little spot! Conveniently located. Great ambiance. Live jazz!The dinner was great and the service prompt.I can't recommend this place enough!

Nice little French restaurant in the heart of Old Montreal. Great starting point for an evening in the old part. Feels like French Quarter inside...also feels like home. We had the lamb poutin, lamb chops, steak frites, and drinks. Everything was very good and best of all, we dined alongside the live music playing inside. Great experience!

Been here five years ago. Went back yesterday. Best experience. Made reservations and seated when arrived. Our waitress Joslane was very attentive and friendly. Live music starting 7pm. Service was great. Will definitely go back again.

Monosh was an attentive and charming server and we selected beautiful dishes - my favorite was the salmon gravlax. Amazing. Also a surprisingly delicious Caesar salad with lardons - the best Caesar dressing I've had. We sat by an open window on a sunny day. It was delightful.

This place is really nice and our waiter was simply the best. When he spoke about the food I thought I was going to have the best meal of my life. So, when food came (and it took a long time to come) I had high expectations. Unfortunately, it was good but not excellent. For that reason I have it 4 stars.

We visited Modavie as part of a weekend trip to Montreal, but were skeptical, given its "touristy" location. We were more than pleasantly surprised by this restaurant, especially by our waitress, Iman. Not only was the food delicious, but our waitress provided expert wine paring and food advice. She even offered a gracious extra wine tasting that paired perfectly with our dessert. We're from Manhattan, and we wish the personal touch back home were even half as great as Iman's.

This was my first time in Montreal and at first I was not impressed UNTIL I discovered this AMAZING French Restaurant, Modavie. My time in Modavie was beyond words due to 2 gentleman by the names of Lorenzo & Radouan. Lorenzo, Maître D' Hôtel, greeted my partner and I with exceptional customer service and flare from the moment we stepped in the building. Lorenzo walked us to our table and introduced us to Radouan, our server. From there Radouan, made us feel completely comfortable and confident in this establishment's commitment to excellence. Wonderful conversation and laughter accompanied by superior menu recommendations. Honestly, my experience of Montreal was saved by the service that both Lorenzo & Radouan provided. Would I come back to Montreal? Yes, only if my first stop is the Modavie!!!
Glorious lamb chops, extraordinary French onion soup, pleasant vibe and attentive servers.  Just a nice spot.  Highly recommend.

You know something is very appetizing when you dig in right away and realize, "Oh! I haven't taken a photo yet!". That's what happened here. We started munching away so excuse the photos I took - you'll see missing lamb chops, cut salmon, missing veggies, quinoa and fries  Everything we ordered we're amazing. Expectation meets reality at this place. It all looks good and tastes really good. Live jazz music added to the overall ambiance as well. I'll definitely come back here if I'm back in Montreal
Great place for mid-size party. Interesting ambience and food was good.

Great truffle mashed potatos. Ordered the chicken dish and it came out super fast... so fast (5 min) that it seemed pre cooked and lightly reheated (food was warm and a but dry).But overall still tasted great

Montreal is a city with many different parts to be seen.  While on vacation with my wife we were walking around Old Montreal.  Taking in all the historic sites and amazing views when it hit us, we were both hungry.  What is one to do, pull up Yelp of course.  Looking for something a little extra we settled on Modavie Resto-Bar.  When we walked into the restaurant we were taking by the old world charm and beauty.  The building itself was clearly from a different time, like much of Old Montreal.  We were sat upstairs at a beautiful window side seat.  It was clear that they were going to be having live music, which was a win in our books, and it looked like the musician was nearly ready to start playing.  However, in the hour that we were at our table not a single note of music was to be heard.  When the server came to our table she gave us water and helped to explain the menu some, as well as lay out the nights' specials.  When she left I notice that there were some black specks in my water. I assumed they were pepper from them recently filling all the shakers, as they were all filled to the brim.  Other than these small hiccups the service overall was great.The food, oh the food.  The part that everyone looks forward to in a restaurant.  We got a complimentary basket of bread.  The bread its self was quite good, soft and chewy in the center with a delicious crunch crust.  The butter on the other hand was rock hard and completely non spreadable. We ordered an appetizer of fried calamari. When it came to the table we were shocked to learn that it came with a side salad, which was very good.  The calamari on the other hand, was dark in color and rubbery in texture.  Clearly overcooked and at the same time lacked seasoning. The paprika mayo dipping sauce was the saving grace of the appetizer for sure.  For me I ordered the steak frites.  This is one of my favorite dishes, I particular enjoy the contrast in textures between the soft tender steak and the crispy fires.  The fries were perfect, salty and crispy just as one would hope they would be.  The steak, which I order medium rare, was close to medium.  It looked as though it had been cut several times, maybe to check the temperature that they missed the mark on.  Overall the steak was tender and moist, however, it too lacked seasoning.  Overall, Modavie is a nice restaurant for atmosphere and service.  The food on the other hand is not as good as the price would lead you to assume.

We stumbled upon Modavie as we were looking for an affordable but classy restaurant for lunch.  We were SO happy we found this restaurant.  Our waitress was very friendly and we got quick and pleasant service.  We were visiting Montreal for a long weekend and got tips on fun nightclubs and events going on from our waitress.  The food was also VERY good and there was a lot of variety on the menu.  Just wish we could have come back to sample more!Among the three of us, we sampled a wide variety.  For apps, we tried the salade mixte with goat cheese, which was light and very good!  We also had the rilette, a rich and filling, but not overly heavy, dish that we all really enjoyed.  The rilette came with bread and a side salad, so it was a nice mix.  We also tried the Toulouse sausage, again a hit - tasty and not too heavy for a summertime lunch.Next, we had the soupe d'ognon, a French classic done to the T! It brought back memories of living in France - excellent execution!  The smoked salmon and fresh cream with capers blinis were good, although the blinis themselves were a bit hard.  I would have preferred a bit of a softer pancake as this was a bit hard to cut through.  I didn't get the feeling that they were fresh (maybe frozen and then microwaved?)  However, the balance between the salmon and tasty fresh cream was just right!  A rich meal that made you feel like you were dining in style! :) Finally, the salade frisee avec lardons was also a success - the frisee had a light dressing, the bacon/lardon balanced out the lightness of the salad and it came with a hardboiled egg.  Again, reminder of a life of leisure in Paris :)Try Modavie if you're on a budget, but still want to eat well.  We stuck with smaller plates and felt very satisfied with the quality and portions!  We'll be back the next time we return to Montreal!

Food was great, especially the fried calamari was amazing! Steak and beef tartare were equally great, the tartare is just a bit too spicy for me personally. However, the service was quite upsetting because there were lowkey racist which I'm surprised to experience that in Canada. It was supposed to be celebrating my boyfriend's birthday and this kinda ruined the night. We ordered too much food and couldn't order any dessert but the server just took the menu away and left without saying anything. Then when my boyfriend was still enjoying his half left glass of wine, our server already gave us the bill. I'm like can't we just sit down and chat and enjoy the wine? That is rude and just felt like they're trying to kick us out. Service wise it's not the best for sure, the food is one of the best that I've tried. However, will never come again. Sorry to say that. But I don't feel respected by the server at Modavie.

I've never met a more friendly and genuine manager. It is my first time in Montreal with my bestfriend and he recognized us after we returned the next day and made sure everything was perfect! He even bought us drinks and asked us to come back and reserved us our own table for the next day! The food was cooked to perfection and amazing drink selection! A definitely must go to spot!!!! Thank you Lorenzo Baldassarre

Was looking for another restaurant but took a wrong turn.  Found Modavie and thought we would try it.  It was amazing!  It was busy but they were able to find us a table in the back by the fireplace.  So cozy!  The food was wonderful, our waiter was the best, very knowledgable about the wine and food.  We had the most lovely experience.  When back in town will definitely go back again.

Surprised i have never been here. But it was a good find in my city. I loved the live blues. My meal was excellent. I wanted the mussels but i was told it was a very unique taste. Which i would not like. So i have the oniin soup and the filet mignon. Both excellent.

My dad and I came here our first night in Montreal and while the reviews were mostly good, I found my experience so-so. The ambiance is great with live jazz music, the decor is rustic and intimate, service is good but the food is nothing incredible. My steak, although tender, did not have much flavor. I'd say you're coming here more for the concept rather than the execution. Still though, a very nice place to enjoy  dinner in Old Montreal.

It started out ok, but went quickly downhill. I ordered the shrimp risotto.  The fish came and was just risotto with some cheese.  I asked if there was an error.  This is after waiting 45 minutes for our food.  She said she had punched in order wrong.  Then she "offered" not to charge me for the shrimp, but still charge for rest of the dish I hadn't ordered and didn't eat.  Don't come here.
Exceptionally loud restaurant volume. Menu is unexciting. I ordered the bolognese, that only had one discernible flavour which was salt. Definitely avoid as the food is clearly not worth the price.

Fantastic.  Mr. Lorenzo's personal touch was engaging, his staff professional, and quick, and the food spectacular.  If you're anywhere near historique Montreal, this is a must go.  It reminded us of a great restaurant in Paris we fell in love with.  It is great for a business meeting, a romantic meal, or a gathering with family and friends.

This place is utterly charming with a warm vibe that's very inviting. We drank some yummy wine and listened to the live music which was very lively and lots of fun. I wish the food was amazing to match the ambiance but it wasn't-- although it was certainly solid and the service was great. Definitely worth the visit!

Went for lunch as it was by our hotel. Food was mediocre, cafeteria quality at best. We ordered a beef tartare appetizer, lamb poutine and Nicosia salad. Wish I had taken some photos!! Tartare was a very dark color and had a livery strange flavor, we didn't finish it as we felt the quality and freshness of the meat was off. The poutine came next, the lamb on top was good, but was served on a. Bed of cold and undercooked fries. Finally, the nicoise arrived and tasted like everything had been prepped and referigerated- the boiled egg and seared tuna were freezing cold. Disappointing experience in a city full of excellent French bistros. Props to the server who was kind enough to remove the two appetizers from the tab when we showed her the quality of the food we received.
A nice place for french foods! Great services!

I celebrated my 30th birthday at Modavie with a big group of friends and we all enjoyed the experience. We made reservations in advance and had a very kind manager email us confirming our reservation and group menu. I was impressed with how good the service was as we were a large group and the resto was packed. The food arrived fairly quickly. I had the salmon which was perfect. The tiramisu was out of this world. I think our entire table was going crazy over the tiramisu. The live jazz was just a cherry on top of a great evening. The next day I got an email from the manager asking if we enjoyed our night at Modavie. Excellent service and experience. I definitely recommend this restaurant for a party.

Walking in the place is like putting on your favorite old sweater -- both comfortable and comforting. Lorenzo greeted us like we were old friends. The wait staff were engaging and attentive. Oh, and the food was fantastic. We had the Poutine and the Beet Salad for starters, and then shared the braised lamb. Really nice presentation and simply wonderful flavors. We loved the experience from start to finish. Highly recommended.

Had dinner here for my anniversary and it was beautiful! Great food, great service, great ambiance, and the live jazz made this place special. Highly recommend coming here if you're looking for a romantic place to bring your significant other!

Our guide recommend this for a dinner when in Montreal.  Traditional French cuisine.The ambiance was nice, and included a live jazz band.  I ordered the steak frites; actually what it says steak and fries.  Standard meal. Nothing to brag about. Maybe other meals are better.  Definitely a great place to sit down, order drinks and listen to good music.And of course the crowd and staff are all a class act!I salute you Montreal!

Exceptional service, ambiance and food. I ordered the lamb rack, which tasted incredible. It could have been a little more pink for medium rare but the flavor was outstanding. Live music was wonderful. I'm taking off one star because there was a bug in one of our drinks. Working in the food industry, I understand this happens, but it grossed me out as it was worm like and had many legs. Overall outstanding and I will definitely come back next time I am in Montreal.

I came here with my family the other night. A very nice bistro with good food and attentive service. A nice selection of American and Canadian wines. The food was excellent and it was a lovely atmosphere. Husband had lamb cavatelli which is shredded lamb with fusilli pasta in a tomato based sauce. I had the tagliatelle with chicken in a light creme sauce. We both liked our dishes. They made my daughter a special entree of spaghetti with gravy and mushrooms and mother in law had the moule frites with Pernod sauce. They enjoyed their meals as well. A good choice when in Old Montreal.  Lorenzo the owner came to our table and had a nice conversation with us.

Out of the five nights we spent in Montreal, my boyfriend and I both agreed this was our favorite restaurant!My boyfriend started off with the French onion soup, which he said was the best he's ever had. Then we shared the escargot puff pastry and lamb poutine, both were incredible!For entrees my boyfriend ordered the rack of lamb, which he devoured and I ordered the butternut squash gnocchi with braised lamb, which was really tasty.The service was excellent, they kept refilling our drinks and there was a live band playing while we ate. Would definitely recommend!

We saw this place when visiting old Montreal and thought it looked cute so we decided to come back later that evening for dinner. We walked in and were able to be seated right away with no reservations. Walking through the dining room/bar area the place has kind of an upscale kind of feel, with a live jazz band playing. The place is nice and a lot bigger then I expected. My partner and I both ordered drinks, he had a martini and I had the cucumber tonic. both dinks were very good. We did not order and appetizer but they do give you bread which is always nice! The waitress we had was very attentive and nice.I ordered the stake frites and was less then impressed. The fries were okay but the stake was eh. It was cooked well but covered in steak sauce or something which I was not really a fan of. The dish was kind of boring, literally just steak with a bunch of fries on the side. Partner had a dish I believe was called chicken supreme which turned out to be pretty good! its nothing I would rave about. Its a 1/2 chicken, baked crispy, served with some potatoes. The place feels nice. The service was good, but I just don't feel the food was anything to rave about. There are so many good places to eat in Montréal, I probably would not return. Maybe I would try it for brunch!
I love this restaurant! Such a warm and cozy and romantic date place. Always love coming here with my boyfriend! The steak and fries are delicious, and I loved there drinks too. 10/10

In Montreal for our anniversary weekend on Saturday Sept 25th.  The place was recommended to us by our hotel as it has live jazz music 6 or 7 nights a week. Modavie is a very nice restaurant with a full service bar. It effectively has 2 dinning rooms and you can hear the music throughout the place but if you want to see the musicians you need to sit in the main one facing the side street. My wife and I both had different fish plates and they were both excellent. Service was friendly, efficient and atmosphere overall very nice. My only disappointment was we were told by the hotel that music played until midnight but it doesn't, it ends around 10 pm. Otherwise I would highly recommend Modavie if you are in old Montreal.

We were looking forward to dinner but left somewhat disappointed. Nice scene, attractive space and great live music. However, our waiter, while polite, was inattentive and seemingly absent minded. We needed to waive him over each and every time we wanted something. The cheese plate needed some honey or jam as it was otherwise unremarkable. The kitchen was very slow in producing plates for us and those around us. Between the delays caused by the waiter and kitchen we elected to pass on having dessert. We had the rack of lamb crusted in sesame and the chicken supreme. Both were cooked nicely but required a little more flavor. We would recommend the earlier seating -- at least then they will serve you in a timely fashion to get you out before the second seating.

we had a later dinner here and had a relatively decent experience but the food could have been better. we stayed til they closed chatting the night away and didnt feel rushed one bit. we also ordered a ton of food to share but some were hit others were miss. overall a nice dining experience but they are super busy

Awesome food and hospitality in MontrealI went to Modavie in the old district of Montreal after reading some good reviews.  I was not disappointed. The host Lorenzo greeted us at the door took time to ask our names and gave us some suggestions on the menu. The food is amazing, like much of the affair in Montreal, it can be referred to as comfort food. The French Onion soup is excellent, the lamb is out of this world. One of us had the Sea Bass which was cooked to perfection and perfectly paired with the sides. I had the lamb chops which were absolutely perfect, very juicy, great flavor, awesome!Our waitress Alexandra and the entire staff really make you feel at home. I strongly recommend Modavie if you are in Montreal!

In Montreal for a work conference and I signed up for a food and architecture tour of old Montréal.  COLD day (I live in NC) walking around historic part of this beautiful city.  One of our foodie stops was at Modavie (translates to: way of life) for poutine.  Old historic stone building with a wonderful fireplace that where the warmth was very welcome.  Owner presented the group with the poutine and talked history of the restaurant.  Most of the poutine was great (fries very average, at best) but the braised lamb and gravy was off the charts!  Rich, thick and pleasingly salty, was very welcome stop on a cold walking day.  We moved on with the tour but Modavie left me wanting for more.....I was so impressed with the atmosphere, passion of the owner and the spirit of the food I sold my work associates on going to dinner here.  Party of four, we sat in a table right off of the bar.  Very homey,welcoming and French feel to the experience.  Our waitress was very good, welcoming, low key but helpful throughout the meal.  She was available when needed but never obtrusive.  Ordered variety of apps -wonderful charcuterie board, salmon tartare, and yes, my associates were hungry for poutine (OK full disclosure time, we sell French fries to the Foodservice industry and all agreed the fries were cold, soggy and short in length.  Call us U.S. fry snobs....guilty!).  Same conclusion as before - great toppings fries average at best.  Entrees appeared at a leisurely pace.  I had roasted salmon on top of couscous with a tomato jam and roasted veggies.  Salmon perfectly cooked to order, whole dish well done and great flavors throughout.Live jazz played in adjoining room throughout our meal - perfect soft volume as we could all converse easily -not too loud!  Our leisurely meal stretched into almost three hours in this rustic French bistro/cafe.  Food, atmosphere and service were all top notch.  My colleagues all thought I was "in the know" to find a place where the locals go in Montréal.  Eventually I had to 'fess up and admit I'd visited earlier I the day as a part of the tour.  If I lived in Montréal Modavie could easily become a way of life....
Get anything with lamb and you won't be disappointed. Came here based off a suggestion on Google. Definitely the best choice for dinner we could have made.
Wine barGreat food and a nice selection of wines. The jazz music is really making a fun atmosphere. Just love that place.
Food was fine but overpriced compared to other nearby restaurants and their respective quality.
Steak with fries is a winner.  We also had mussels and the fish special trout bot good.  Bread is on point as well as the service.   I'd come back again... good eats...

I was walking through the area when I stumbled upon this place and I do not regret it! This is definitely one of the best restaurants that I've been to. I got the pasta stuffed with seafood and it was AMAZING. Great ambiance as well which is always a plus. The only thing that could have been better is that our server wasn't that attentive however she was still very sweet.

Come here for: cozy spot when you're freezing your a** off on the rue - caveat I came in for a tea and dessert only Food: I was disappointed with the creme brûlée. It was so shallow that the ratio of sugar top to custard was off. I could only taste the sugar and the custard itself was missing Ambience: actual roaring fire! There is also a large bar Service: nothing to complain and nothing to write home about
Fantastic night at Modavie!  Their lamb chops do not disappoint; Delicious.  Wait staff are pros, ambiance lovely with live music.  A must-visit for all in Montreal.
Loved and enjoyed our dining experience. This place made out Montréal vacation very memorable.

A bit pricey for the food, but good service, atmosphere, and food. Live music venue in upscale restaurant. We went around 9 pm in September and it was somewhat busy, but we were able to be seated right away. The waitress did a great job of keeping our water glasses filled and checking in with us. Our food orders did not take long. I ordered the seafood linguine and my wife ordered the spaghetti bolognese. Both dishes were good, but we expected better for the price.Main courses are around $25 to $50 a plate. Expect to pay around $40 to $60 a person for a main course and a drink.We recommend this place for a casual dinner date with light conversation. Do not expect to be able to have an in-depth conversation at the table.

I had a very enjoyable meal here in May, on a very busy night. Despite the restaurant being full, our waiter was attentive and friendly, and even indulged our request for a photograph. We had no complaints about the drinks (bellini, rose sangria and the grapefruit cocktail) or the food (lamb burger, lamb pasta and duck). I would definitely go back, if I was looking for a sure bet in the Old Montreal area. It isn't the trendiest choice in the area, but it is a warm atmosphere, with good service (and live jazz, if you book a table in the main room).

Cute restaurant. Food was excellent. I had the lamb which was really good. The atmosphere is really nice and relaxed.  The service is also very good. A little on the pricier side. However I found it to be worth it given the portion sizes were pretty good and the service. I would recommend this place for sure to anyone going to Montreal. They also have a really good selection of wines.

I picked this place because Iove Mondavi wine which is not related to Mondavie, but it allowed me to experience some delicious food! The atmosphere is very quaint and romantic. A perfect spot to enjoy some amazing food without being interrupted by loud music or fellow diners. I had the lamb and it literally fell off the bone when I touched it with my fork. Get the limon cake if you're into dessert, its a little creamy but the crust is totally worth it. Waiter was great and even taught me a few french words. Also, they bring out some white bread with butter in the beginning which I love because no one wants to sit and wait for their food when they are starving.

Had a wonderful dinner on a cold January evening. Made reservations 3 days before to ensure we would have a table on a Saturday night!  One word of caution, parking in Old Montreal is not always easy.  We had to park a little walk away!  As we entered the restaurant we noticed it had a nice cosy dark feel to it with an open kitchen and a bar tucked just under the staircase to the second floor.  We had a smaller sized table against the wall(2nd floor) but had a good view of the small stage where music would soon commence.  I started with a glass of the Carnivor Cab Sav ($9 a glass) and my wife had the Cosmo pastis $9.  nice light Cab Sav.  We both ordered soup, mine the french onion ($8) and she had the soup of the day cream of broccoli!($5).  Onion soup au gratin was okay 3/5 missing some onion filling but definitely had a nice taste to it just it could have been better.  My wife's however was much better (she gave me a taste).  For main's I had the steak frites ($23) and she had the Salmon tournedos with lentils ($21).  The SF was fantastic.  The cut was a hanger steak (bavette de boeuf) a bit chewy but had a very nice shallot sauce and was just as I had in mind.  Ordered it rare!  My wife was very happy with the Salmon tornedo.  She said freshness and flavour was great!  The portion size was perfect for her.  Not too large not too small!  I was watching the servers bring food to different tables and it looked like 60% of the people ordering were selecting the rack of lamb with oregano or the one with goat cheese.   As we were eating a nice blues band started to play and the place started to fill up quickly shortly between 7 - 7:15 PM.  The band was quite good and added to a nice ambiance that fit the mood of the place.  The only negative I would mention is I believe there to be too many tables upstairs.  I told my wife "I would not want to be upstairs if there was a fire as you felt that there would be a mad stampede"!  Heading to the washroom you had to skinny through tables to the restrooms.    For dessert I had the Kahlua tiramisu and she had the Apple tart with Ice Cream.  My tiramisu was really good.  Nice and light and as a Tiramisu should taste.  My wife was disappointed with her apple tart.  It was basically a cored apple in a shell with cinnamon and a scoop of ice cream!  All in all this is a fabulous restaurant and we really enjoyed the experience and would definitely come back even though there were a few missteps!  Thanks Risa and Katherine!  Happening Gourmand GC greatly appreciated!  Rock on!
I terribly enjoyed the steak, with mouthwatering gravy, the mashed potatoes were just softened in the mouth. The service was excellent and quick.

I'm giving Modavie an official 3 Star rating after my third visit last night. Modavie is likely the restaurant you'll be directed to in Old Port if you're looking for a dining setting with some live jazz music. For me, it all comes down to service. Each time I've visited Modavie, I've experienced some kind of issue with rude and/or visibly overworked staff members. Last night's experience started with a very out "of sorts hostess" who guaranteed us we would not get a table and, after we asked for a second opinion, changed her tune and found us a decent spot upstairs. I'm not saying people need to be perfect but a positive attitude is foundational in any service job. Food wise, it's hit and miss. My go to is typically the pork cheek risotto. You can't go wrong with the charcuterie boards. Most of their cheeses and pates are home made. And lastly, the reason you end up at Modavie, the live music. Totally makes coming here worth it. Will I be back? Most likely. Will I enjoy it? It's different every time.
Sat at the bar snd service was great. Mussels and fries were delicious and I would recommend to anyone looking for a delicious meal with some music playing in the background. Happy hour runs until 7.

My sister and I were touring the city when it starting snowing pretty hard so we decided to take shelter and warm up at Modavie. We started with the foie gras, French onion soup, and lamb poutine --- all of which were very good. My favorite out of our appetizers was surprisingly the lamb poutine. The fries were crisp and the lamb was delicious. It was our favorite poutine out of the ones that we tried during our visit. Even though our waiter touted that their French onion was the best in the city, I thought it was just decent and not really worthy of the $10 price tag. For my entree, I ordered the duck confit which was executed very well. The duck was nice and moist throughout and the skin was delicious. My sister's lamb was cooked to a medium rather than the medium rare that we had requested, but it was still very tender and flavorful so we didn't make a fuss. As our dessert, we tried their vanilla panna cotta which was just the right amount of sweetness to end the meal with. Overall, it was a great experience and we were glad to have such a nice haven during the storm.

French Bistro with music during dinner. Pretty great wine list ! My salmon was good and the soup of the day gazpacho was excellent. My husband enjoyed Mediterranean pasta with tofu. Just wish we could hear the music a bit more. Maybe better sound system? Wait staff was excellent.

My boyfriend and I stopped in here for an afternoon drink and snack.   We had been walking around the old port and came across this beautiful little corner spot.  The exterior is very charming and inside even better.  The interior design and details were well thought out.  The waitress was very kind and accommodating and found us a nice table off to the side.  Our waitress was very attentive and pleasant and explained the menu well.   We ended up ordering a French onion soup, Charcuterie Board along with two glasses of wine.  Food had lots of flavour and the wine was lovely.  It was a little on the pricey side, however location, decor, food quality and service made it worth the $80.

My wife and I had Christmas dinner here. We loved every bit of this establishment! The service was exceptional and my lamb burger was the best I ever had. When in Montreal, this place is recommended in the heart of Old Montreal. It is a real gem of an establishment.

Had a wonderful dinner here last night. Service super attentive and friendly. Menu was varied, food was delicious. Lamb cavatelli fantastic, highly recommended. Salmon simple but cooked nicely,tasty. Beet salad, calamari great. Lamb poutine was really good. Lamb hamburger excellent. (Went here with the family so got to sample a lot!)Drinks were very good, tiramisu dessert nice. Entertainment was an unexpected bonus:jazz singer starting at 7 pm- great music, not too loud to affect conversation-really added to what is already a wonderful atmosphere. Restaurant has a great ambiance. Great location -near heart of old Montreal but not too loud some other streets. Prices were very fair. In all, the family and I loved this place.

You might want to remove the osso buco off your menu - you're not doing yourself a favor.  Sorry ... we both abandoned the whole dinners (not even a third way thru) for greener pastures. Out of respect for your locale and certainly efforts (restaurant business especially is not an easy one), I won't mention here where.

The food, service and drinks were easily a solid 4- everyone loved their food (however, the accompanying risotto needed more flavor), but steaks were perfect, as was my fish. The location is also fantastic and right in the heart of Vieux Port. This was our last big meal of a family vacation. As we were a large party, we were seated upstairs. The downside to this? We were competing with the volume of 30+ very boisterous diners, perhaps all co-workers? Their volume, coupled with the high ceilings, made for an almost deafening experience. It's a shame because it hindered our ability to have conversation that didn't include shouting.
Bread....all we wanted was bread....we nearly starved to death waiting for the rest of our party...   and after all of this... they have Metro desserts for 5x the price... good show Modavie!!

Ambiance and food were excellent. I had the risotto with wild boar. My wife had the hanger steak and frites. Both were amazing. We were seated in the room with live music which for me personally is always hit and miss. There was maybe a little too much time between courses but not a huge deal. Make a reservation because you'll need one.

Thanks to everyone at Modavie for a delicious meal and great evening in old Montreal.  A special thanks to Lorenzo, The Maitre d' and Marie Eve, our server for making us feel more like family than just guests. We will be back again next time we visit Montreal.Nancy and Gary

This was definitely the mistake in a recent visit to Montreal during the Jazz Festival.  Not sure how this place has 4 stars on Yelp given that everything was average at best.  Music? It was okay.  Atmosphere?  The front bar section was beautifully done but you couldn't hear the music and the main dining room was fairly tightly spaced and not exciting.  Cocktails were okay, wine list was okay, and the food was just okay.  The lamb burger was actually better than average and cooked nicely plus it was served with a side of decent fries which appeared to be completely unsalted and we didn't get any condiments delivered to the table until halfway through the meal.  The lamb cavatelli pasta was completely under-seasoned, not great even after adding salt, and had 3 tiny little scraps of braised lamb in the entire large plate.If you're looking for a tourist trap in Old Montreal, you've found it.  We didn't mean to end up here but we did for one night and it was by far my worst decision on a 4 day visit to Montreal.  If I weren't from New Orleans I might have lower expectations and may have potentially enjoyed this place more, but I easily could have done a whole lot better at home and will long be disappointed by wasting a meal at Modavie while at the Jazz Festival in Montreal.  Oh well, lesson learned.

A beautiful restaurant in the Old Port of Montreal.Live bands on both the 1st and 2nd floor. Unfortunately, the night began with our bottle of wine being spilt on us. Fortunately it was white wine. They (the manager and waiter) excused themselves and immediately replaced the wine. I ordered the Penne with lamb, which was bland. She ordered the seafood risotto which was delicious.Unfortunately, they also forgot about the birthday reminder I had mentioned in the opentable comments in the reservation. Under normal circumstances, I would have mentioned this to the waiter, but I didn't bother reminding them since I was busy enjoying her company & the live music. At the end of the night, as I was about to pay the bill. I couldn't bring myself to just ignore the poor service that we received, so I called to speak with the manager. We spent the next 15 mins talking... unfortunately i don't feel it changed anything.We dine often in Montreal, and much smaller incidents are treated very seriously. I prefer to spend my time in a place that knows how to provide an excellent ambiance and service, and unfortunately Modavie does not meet our standards.

Amazing live music...they even managed to squeeze me in without reservation letting me know they would need my table after 9PM. i liked the hostess honesty. Great group of ladies.Unfortunately same cannot be said for server or food here necessarily. I was feeling a tender steak and made a point to ask the server which of their Bavette or strip loin is most tender. He told me the strip loin...so I trusted him. The person next to me was having steak frites...his looked perfectly cooked medium rare. I got my steak. Well done to hell. I told my server and he looked at my well done cross section and said "yes you mentioned medium rare..." Mind blowing stupidity. I said its over cooked and not medium rare....he says in Canada it's medium rare...I said if this is medium rare...what the hell is well done? Charred to shit?Anyways he claimed I should have ordered it blue and brought me a newer steak. It was better but not medium rare. More like medium. Steak was delicious but the vegetables were so/so.I'd recommend the place for live music and OK food. Not great for perfect steaks. Prices reasonable but the food I would sort of say is below par.

where are vegetarian so we were a little anxious when we got in and everything seems to be neat but then we noticed that there was a butternut squash pasta dish. we both opted for that and the beet salad and were pleasantly surprised! we both would get the same meal again as well as the warm bread and smiles.

An old building on the edge of  touristy Old Montreal. A nice interior of exposed brick and wood. There was a band playing jazzed up renditions of 90's songs which made for nice ambiance.We ate the charcuterie board, I had the lamb chops by recommendation dessert and a few featured cocktails. It was a nice experience and the lamb was tippy top!
Had a great meal here with my family. The french onion soup was delicious and The service was great. Strongly recommend stopping in and having a meal
The salami and cheese platter is amazing. Great place to dine on the go while exploring the Old Port. Definitely recommend.

The restaurant was full, reservation was tight on the weekend but we barely made it. Food was really nice and our waiter was really helpful and amazing. I had the beet salad, which was delicious and a Fillet Mignon - medium well. Also my husband had the lamb burger with the goat cheese - OMG delicious

loved the vibe here. sat right next to the band playing and they were really good! for sure made the dining experience so much better. i got the chicken with truffle mashed potatoes and veggies. the food came out so fast and it was delicious!
The food was decent but outdated. It tastes like wedding food. The love music was far too loud to have any sort of conversation.

This was my favourite stop during my trip to Montreal. The atmosphere of this place made it an enjoyable night. We came without a reservation and were seated immediately. The room we were seated in was the one that had the live music in. The other guests were getting into the music, dancing and singing along. I ordered the carrot risotto and it was DELICIOUS! The portion seemed small at first but once I ate it all I was stuffed and couldn't eat it anymore. We were in and out of the restaurant in about an hour and a half. This restaurant was such a pleasure to go to and I would definitely recommend it to everyone!!

Came with my boyfriend from Toronto to Montreal over family day weekend. This was our first stop after a long day of driving! My boyfriend had a reservation for 8:15 and when we got to the restaurant we were shown to a table right away. We requested a table with live music & got to sit upstairs in front of the performers for the night. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and has an excellent ambience. Great for groups or special events. For starters, we got the lamb poutine which we both loved! For our mains, I got the rack of lamb, as per the server's recommendation, and my boyfriend got the seafood risotto. My lamb was amazing! By far, the best lamb I've ever had. My boyfriend was also very happy with his seafood risotto. For dessert, I ordered a creme brulee and he ordered the pouding chomeur. Overall, with the quality of the food, service, and fun atmosphere, this was our favourite dining experience we've ever had together! We will be definitely coming back to  Modavie for our next trip to Montreal together.

I will start this review by saying that halfway through the dinner my partner and I shared here, we had relatively high hopes. My cocktail (Fitzgerald) and her rosé were both lovely. The foie gras torchon was good, and the very friendly and accommodating waiter suggested a wine pairing with the appetizer that ended up complimenting the dish very appropriately. However after this it went somewhat downhill. The wait time grew long, and we saw the waiter less and less. Finally, our entrees came out. The wild boar osso bucco was entirely lacking any seasoning. The risotto was dull and flavorless. The steak was rare as requested but clearly had not been rested properly and also lacked seasoning. The fries were okay, but there were far too many of them. The truffle mayo was also good. If given the choice, I'd probably stop in for a drink but pass on dinner. Cheers.

We took the table d'hôte. My duck tagliatelle tasted like beef bouillon chunks at times. His lamb shank in apricot sauce had no apricots in it and tasted like "cafeteria food." The wine was excellent as was the tea served with mediocre desserts.
Terrible service.  Sat at the bar waiting to order while the bartender talked with the musician.

I feel somewhat bad rating this place at 3 stars, as the ambience of the place is great, the live music is excellent, the staff are very friendly, attentive and not overbearing - all the right elements for success. The only problem is the food - it is average at best. Since the main reason for visiting a restaurant is the necessary task of eating, it is kind of pointless to visit a place with mediocre food. No reason to repeat.
We had a pleasant lunch outside, people watching. Food was great, our staff was so friendly. A little pricey.

Generally reservations only. If it's a weekend or holiday and you don't have a reservation, the only choice is sitting at the bar for an overly priced meal. They say that they are known for thier lamb but I think it's only because it's the highest priced item on the menu. We started out with the French onion soup which was probably the best French onion soup that I have ever had. Also ordered the octopus salad which was over dressed with oil and had about 5 small pieces of octopus ($15!!). My bf had the rack of lamb which was maybe at best a solid 2. I had the mussels and fries which was pretty decent but not for the price of $30. Would come back for the soup but that's it. Not worth the $30-$40 entrees. If it wasn't for the soup, I would give a rating of 1.5.

I do t enjoy writing a bad review. So all I will say is that in my opinion I have no idea how this Restaurant revived the exceptionally high rating it did and considered the top restaurant in Old Town Montreal. The service is lovely but the food is not good. The French onion soup was very salty, the salmon did not taste fresh the salad had store bought old croutons.

The lamb was the best that I have ever had and the service was top notch. The wait to get what we ordered was a little slow. The place was packed the entire time we were there. The music was good but a little to loud. This a great place to eat at if you are in the city
Amazing food.. Great ambience. Very good live music, very nice staff and very delicious desserts. One of the best restaurant in Montreal

Went here for anniversary. Great place. Made a reservation for 8, but was in the area earlier and was seated at 6pm with no issues. They told us we needed to be out by 8, so they could use the table which was weird. but we weren't rushed by our waitress and seated immediately. So many thanks there to the great staff.Ordered beet salad for an appetizer and it was tremendous. All the ingredients were very fresh. For an entree, i ordered the duck confit and mushroom risotto. Where the risotto lacked in salt and flavor, the duck made up for. Cooked perfectly. The beau ordered lamb chops, which she said lacked any kind of flavor, so that along with my risotto is the reason for the 4 stars. I'd visit again, perhaps try something else.

Had a great experience here with my family. Live music was really a bonus. Food was pretty good and staff was super friendly. It was my mothers birthday and they offered a little cake and candle without hesitation.

Wasn't exactly impressed with Modavie. I'm not sure if it was because we came for lunch but then again, it shouldn't matter if it was lunch or dinner. The food was just really average and it felt like one of those moments where, oh well, we needed a place for lunch anyway so at least we had something to fill our stomachs from Modavie.Lunch order came with a choice of daily starter or soup. I chose the daily starter which was a small plate of salad. The salad didn't look exactly very compelling or attractive presentation wise--- light green chopped lettuce, sliced almonds and pieces of mandarin oranges. Sounds pretty good in writing, right? The pieces of mandarin still had the white pith hanging from all the pieces. It looked like if I was peeling the orange myself at home for a quick snack while standing over the kitchen sink.My lamb sandwich sounded great on the menu though there was nothing that stood out from it. The lamb was tossed with brown gravy and the meat was tender, but that was it. It didn't do anything else for me, taste wise. I asked my husband how was his smoked salmon and said "It was good but not great."

Located right in the centre of old montreal, this restaurant was one of the only ones open on Christmas. It was suppose to have live jazz music but we didn't see a live band.The restaurant is separated into two areas, the bar area which is more rustic but still has table seating, and the main dining room. We enjoyed the rustic feel of the bar area, felt much more Christmas'ee.We ordered the charcuterie and cheese boards, both were very standard and nothing to rave about. The mains were however,  delicious. Our table had ordered the steak frites, the rack of lamb, the duck confit, and the risotto. The steak frites was probably the most standard/boring main - a bit dry in my opinion. The lamb was juicy and tender, done to perfection. The risotto was very creamy and flavourful - served in a very large portion considering how heavy this is. Last but not least, and everyone's favourite, was the duck confit; a good size leg, juicy and tender!!
We loved this restaurant.  It was amazing.  Great experience with Francois.  He made our visit and meal special.Thank you Francois!Carey and Dianne

Oh wow.. this was a treat. I don't think there is anything you could order you wouldn't happy with. Impressive service and plating! The music was great, the atmosphere wonderful. The vibe wasn't to much but yet electric at the same time. Four of us from the office went (3 of us from Atlanta, GA) and really enjoyed this experience.

I was really afraid that this is one of those tourists trap given its location. Turned out that it's really a nice bistro with well-priced food, great live music and pleasant decor in old-montreal style building.We came for the happening gourmand event with the set menu. Mushroom Risotto with duck confit was well-seasoned and in generous portion. The dessert was great. Not much comment on my appetizer but my friend who ordered salmon tartare looked delicious (she did say that the calamari is not her best). The highlight of this place is the live music and impeccable service if you want more than just good food. (It took us 20min to get the table even with a reservation, but the owner kept apologizing and served us free 10-year-old port wine with our desserts).

We came here for dinner one weekend when we're were visiting Montreal. The service was incredible, our waiter Kim was attentive and personable. The drinks were delicious and creatively named. I highly recommend the bullies de menthe if you like mint. We started with the lamb poutine and the charcuterie plate, both of which were incredible. The entrees were sub-par and underseasoned: the lamb burger was over cooked, the truffle cream sauce tagliatelle didn't taste like truffle at all, but the risotto and lamb was cooked perfectly. Overall, I would recommend this spot for a nice dinner and live music.
Food was bland, dry and tasteless! I don't understand all the wonderful reviews. The service was warm and very welcoming. Location is great, but the food was not all that. Prices are ok for the area.

Lovely atmosphere, ambience, live jazz, very dim lights all those great things. The only thing missing was a real flame in our candle (we got a tea light). Our server was really cool and friendly, effortlessly so, unlike some servers who try really hard to be cool but aren't, she was truly cool, but not too cool. Great service. Food was fantastic. If you love lamb as much as I do. The lamb is the buzz at this restaurant. Too bad I could only afford the lamb poutine. The rack of lamb is 39 dollars I wish I could've tried it. My girlfriend had spaghetti and meatballs  The pasta was delicious, al dente (it had bite!). And the meatballs were monstrous. It was courteous of her to ask how many she wanted. I mean huge. Baseballs of meat. They were really delicious baseballs of meat!

Live music, intimate atmosphere, good food. Chose here because of the live music and it didn't disappoint. I had the lamb because Lorenzo said it was their specialty, and it was excellent. My gf had the seafood pasta and she liked it as well.

Phenomenal lab chops.  One of the best I've had.  Lamb Poutine was also very good & hit the spot.  My wife had the Filet and was very happy with the cut, temperature and texture.  She raved about the truffle mashed potatoes.

I would have given this a 4-star based on food and ambience alone, but the service was outstanding and elevated that.  We were looking for live music and we mentioned this when checking in at 9:30, so the manager Lorenzo asked the band to continue playing after their 10:00pm ending time just for us.  Decent blues duo (guitar and bass) on a Thursday night.  The food was all good - lamb burger, ratatouille, onion soup.  The wine was an old bottle with sentiment (maybe not stored properly) and the overcooked and underseasoned  rack of lamb were the only underwhelming things.The server Caroline was a delight and even invited our 12-year old daughter to come and help torch the Creme Brûlée.  It is a beautiful restaurant in Old Montreal and well worth a visit.

2nd time here in a week while visiting Montreal so that should tell you something. Live music is a plus. The duck confit with mushroom risotto was excellent. The tiramisu is one of the best I have had.
Great live music. Pretty good food and good service. One of my favorties in Montreal.

Excellent food as well as excellent and very friendly and professional service. Very nice location nestled in old Montréal. Such a great place to visit. I highly recommend adding this one to your list!

The ambiance at Modavie is everything you could ask for for a date night. When making reservations, we asked to sit in the live music section. I was pleasantly surprised that we had a table right by the stage. I wanted to love this place really badly. However, it just didn't work for me. I decided to go with the "Table D'hôte" menu. For appetizer, I got the pork rilletes. Unfortunately, it tasted like bland chicken salad. I was extremely excited about the brook char, but became extremely disappointed once it came out. My entree had no flavor profile. Everything on the plate clashed. The char barely had any salt or pepper. The beets tasted like they came straight out of a can, and the "corn chowder" was comprised of corn, potatoes and peas. Oh, and some cucumber was thrown on top. Everything on that plate disagreed with each other. For dessert, I had the pudding chameux - a fluffy cake with a maple syrup soft crust and vanilla ice cream. It was delicious! I learned it was a typical dessert in Montréal, passed down by generations. Our server was amazing and extremely attentive. She was kind and made sure that we felt important. The dessert and our server saved the night for us.

Alas I know this place is top rated, but you could not tell based on our experience.  Very crowded.  The kitchen extremely busy, we were sitting right next to it.  Our entree was a substitute for one on the menu, so we got Gnocchi Gourge:  fatty meat tasteless pasta, no sauce, too al dente.  Appetizers, calamari and escargot, were over done and tasteless.  Promises made on their website were not kept.  Great Caesar salad, but that could not make up for the disappointment.
Great service, fast and attentive, food is very good and the atmosphere is great! Defintely will come back next time I'm in town.

The food here was spectacular. Although slightly overpriced (as are most restaurants in Vieux-Port), I enjoyed my meal and left very satisfied. The service was amazing, our waitress, I believe her name was Alexa, was helpful and efficient. The soup of the day, a tomato basque, was delicious and affordable compared to their pricer main dishes. My friend who ate the Lamb, I'm a vegetarian so didn't try it, said it was amazing. If you're in old town and are willing to spend a little more than normal on a great meal in a place with phenomenal ambiance, I recommend eating here for dinner. Also, the cheese plate for 2 served our party of 4 perfectly and coupled with the free bread was delicious.

This was an amazing musical and culinary experience. My husband and I came more so for the music but the food had exceeded my expectations we were seated on the second floor not to far from the talented musicians.

Really nice decor and great customer service. Great collection of cocktails. I orders two drinks. I will come back  again. Recommend drinks: Bellini Kochi, French something. Sangria rose is kind of light to me. Sapgattgti Bolognese is wonderful.

Came here on our second to last day in Montreal, after having been here for a week and not having one exciting meal.The food was amazing!! Started with fresh calamari, followed by the rack of lamb with goat cheese and it didn't disappoint. Ended the night off with some warm homemade apple pie that was the cherry on top for a great evening in a beautiful restaurant. I will definitely be back on my next visit during the summer!

Love this place. Excellent modern French bistro prepared with care. Multiple environments ranging from bar bistro, to jazz lounge to outdoor, on a bustling street. Hade the Cassoulet and it was excellent. Escargot appetizer was best I've tasted. The Salmon filet moist and flavorful. Stay for dessert, you won't be disappointed.
Enjoyed the Seafood linguine  it was fantastic!!! The mustard in the ham platter out of this world! One of the best meals we had in Montreal!
